class AwsCredentials(prefect.blocks.abstract.CredentialsBlock): 
 60class AwsCredentials(CredentialsBlock):
 61    """
 62    Block used to manage authentication with AWS. AWS authentication is
 63    handled via the `boto3` module. Refer to the
 64    [boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html)
 65    for more info about the possible credential configurations.
 66
 67    Example:
 68        Load stored AWS credentials:
 69        ```python
 70        from prefect_aws import AwsCredentials
 71
 72        aws_credentials_block = AwsCredentials.load("BLOCK_NAME")
 73        ```
 74    """  # noqa E501
 75
 76    _logo_url = "https://cdn.sanity.io/images/3ugk85nk/production/d74b16fe84ce626345adf235a47008fea2869a60-225x225.png"  # noqa
 77    _block_type_name = "AWS Credentials"
 78    _documentation_url = "https://prefecthq.github.io/prefect-aws/credentials/#prefect_aws.credentials.AwsCredentials"  # noqa
 79
 80    aws_access_key_id: Optional[str] = Field(
 81        default=None,
 82        description="A specific AWS access key ID.",
 83        title="AWS Access Key ID",
 84    )
 85    aws_secret_access_key: Optional[SecretStr] = Field(
 86        default=None,
 87        description="A specific AWS secret access key.",
 88        title="AWS Access Key Secret",
 89    )
 90    aws_session_token: Optional[str] = Field(
 91        default=None,
 92        description=(
 93            "The session key for your AWS account. "
 94            "This is only needed when you are using temporary credentials."
 95        ),
 96        title="AWS Session Token",
 97    )
 98    profile_name: Optional[str] = Field(
 99        default=None, description="The profile to use when creating your session."
100    )
101    region_name: Optional[str] = Field(
102        default=None,
103        description="The AWS Region where you want to create new connections.",
104    )
105    aws_client_parameters: AwsClientParameters = Field(
106        default_factory=AwsClientParameters,
107        description="Extra parameters to initialize the Client.",
108        title="AWS Client Parameters",
109    )
110
111    class Config:
112        """Config class for pydantic model."""
113
114        arbitrary_types_allowed = True
115
116    def __hash__(self):
117        field_hashes = (
118            hash(self.aws_access_key_id),
119            hash(self.aws_secret_access_key),
120            hash(self.aws_session_token),
121            hash(self.profile_name),
122            hash(self.region_name),
123            hash(self.aws_client_parameters),
124        )
125        return hash(field_hashes)
126
127    def get_boto3_session(self) -> boto3.Session:
128        """
129        Returns an authenticated boto3 session that can be used to create clients
130        for AWS services
131
132        Example:
133            Create an S3 client from an authorized boto3 session:
134            ```python
135            aws_credentials = AwsCredentials(
136                aws_access_key_id = "access_key_id",
137                aws_secret_access_key = "secret_access_key"
138                )
139            s3_client = aws_credentials.get_boto3_session().client("s3")
140            ```
141        """
142
143        if self.aws_secret_access_key:
144            aws_secret_access_key = self.aws_secret_access_key.get_secret_value()
145        else:
146            aws_secret_access_key = None
147
148        return boto3.Session(
149            aws_access_key_id=self.aws_access_key_id,
150            aws_secret_access_key=aws_secret_access_key,
151            aws_session_token=self.aws_session_token,
152            profile_name=self.profile_name,
153            region_name=self.region_name,
154        )
155
156    def get_client(self, client_type: Union[str, ClientType]):
157        """
158        Helper method to dynamically get a client type.
159
160        Args:
161            client_type: The client's service name.
162
163        Returns:
164            An authenticated client.
165
166        Raises:
167            ValueError: if the client is not supported.
168        """
169        if isinstance(client_type, ClientType):
170            client_type = client_type.value
171
172        return _get_client_cached(ctx=self, client_type=client_type)
173
174    def get_s3_client(self) -> S3Client:
175        """
176        Gets an authenticated S3 client.
177
178        Returns:
179            An authenticated S3 client.
180        """
181        return self.get_client(client_type=ClientType.S3)
182
183    def get_secrets_manager_client(self) -> SecretsManagerClient:
184        """
185        Gets an authenticated Secrets Manager client.
186
187        Returns:
188            An authenticated Secrets Manager client.
189        """
190        return self.get_client(client_type=ClientType.SECRETS_MANAGER)

class AwsClientParameters(pydantic.v1.main.BaseModel): 
 19class AwsClientParameters(BaseModel):
 20    """
 21    Model used to manage extra parameters that you can pass when you initialize
 22    the Client. If you want to find more information, see
 23    [boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/core/session.html)
 24    for more info about the possible client configurations.
 25
 26    Attributes:
 27        api_version: The API version to use. By default, botocore will
 28            use the latest API version when creating a client. You only need
 29            to specify this parameter if you want to use a previous API version
 30            of the client.
 31        use_ssl: Whether or not to use SSL. By default, SSL is used.
 32            Note that not all services support non-ssl connections.
 33        verify: Whether or not to verify SSL certificates. By default
 34            SSL certificates are verified. If False, SSL will still be used
 35            (unless use_ssl is False), but SSL certificates
 36            will not be verified. Passing a file path to this is deprecated.
 37        verify_cert_path: A filename of the CA cert bundle to
 38            use. You can specify this argument if you want to use a
 39            different CA cert bundle than the one used by botocore.
 40        endpoint_url: The complete URL to use for the constructed
 41            client. Normally, botocore will automatically construct the
 42            appropriate URL to use when communicating with a service. You
 43            can specify a complete URL (including the "http/https" scheme)
 44            to override this behavior. If this value is provided,
 45            then ``use_ssl`` is ignored.
 46        config: Advanced configuration for Botocore clients. See
 47            [botocore docs](https://botocore.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/config.html)
 48            for more details.
 49    """  # noqa E501
 50
 51    api_version: Optional[str] = Field(
 52        default=None, description="The API version to use.", title="API Version"
 53    )
 54    use_ssl: bool = Field(
 55        default=True, description="Whether or not to use SSL.", title="Use SSL"
 56    )
 57    verify: Union[bool, FilePath] = Field(
 58        default=True, description="Whether or not to verify SSL certificates."
 59    )
 60    verify_cert_path: Optional[FilePath] = Field(
 61        default=None,
 62        description="Path to the CA cert bundle to use.",
 63        title="Certificate Authority Bundle File Path",
 64    )
 65    endpoint_url: Optional[str] = Field(
 66        default=None,
 67        description="The complete URL to use for the constructed client.",
 68        title="Endpoint URL",
 69    )
 70    config: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = Field(
 71        default=None,
 72        description="Advanced configuration for Botocore clients.",
 73        title="Botocore Config",
 74    )
 75
 76    def __hash__(self):
 77        return hash(
 78            (
 79                self.api_version,
 80                self.use_ssl,
 81                self.verify,
 82                self.verify_cert_path,
 83                self.endpoint_url,
 84                hash_collection(self.config),
 85            )
 86        )
 87
 88    @validator("config", pre=True)
 89    def instantiate_config(cls, value: Union[Config, Dict[str, Any]]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 90        """
 91        Casts lists to Config instances.
 92        """
 93        if isinstance(value, Config):
 94            return value.__dict__["_user_provided_options"]
 95        return value
 96
 97    @root_validator
 98    def deprecated_verify_cert_path(cls, values: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 99        """
100        If verify is not a bool, raise a warning.
101        """
102        verify = values.get("verify")
103
104        # deprecate using verify in favor of verify_cert_path
105        # so the UI looks nicer
106        if verify is not None and not isinstance(verify, bool):
107            warnings.warn(
108                (
109                    "verify should be a boolean. "
110                    "If you want to use a CA cert bundle, use verify_cert_path instead."
111                ),
112                DeprecationWarning,
113            )
114        return values
115
116    @root_validator
117    def verify_cert_path_and_verify(cls, values: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
118        """
119        If verify_cert_path is set but verify is False, raise a warning.
120        """
121        verify = values.get("verify", True)
122        verify_cert_path = values.get("verify_cert_path")
123
124        if not verify and verify_cert_path:
125            warnings.warn(
126                "verify_cert_path is set but verify is False. "
127                "verify_cert_path will be ignored."
128            )
129            values["verify_cert_path"] = None
130        elif not isinstance(verify, bool) and verify_cert_path:
131            warnings.warn(
132                "verify_cert_path is set but verify is also set as a file path. "
133                "verify_cert_path will take precedence."
134            )
135            values["verify"] = True
136        return values
137
138    def get_params_override(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
139        """
140        Return the dictionary of the parameters to override.
141        The parameters to override are the one which are not None.
142        """
143        params = self.dict()
144        if params.get("verify_cert_path"):
145            # to ensure that verify doesn't re-overwrite verify_cert_path
146            params.pop("verify")
147
148        params_override = {}
149        for key, value in params.items():
150            if value is None:
151                continue
152            elif key == "config":
153                params_override[key] = Config(**value)
154                # botocore UNSIGNED is an instance while actual signers can
155                # be fetched as strings
156                if params_override[key].signature_version == "unsigned":
157                    params_override[key].signature_version = UNSIGNED
158            elif key == "verify_cert_path":
159                params_override["verify"] = value
160            else:
161                params_override[key] = value
162        return params_override

Model used to manage extra parameters that you can pass when you initialize the Client. If you want to find more information, see boto3 docs for more info about the possible client configurations.

Attributes: api_version: The API version to use. By default, botocore will use the latest API version when creating a client. You only need to specify this parameter if you want to use a previous API version of the client. use_ssl: Whether or not to use SSL. By default, SSL is used. Note that not all services support non-ssl connections. verify: Whether or not to verify SSL certificates. By default SSL certificates are verified. If False, SSL will still be used (unless use_ssl is False), but SSL certificates will not be verified. Passing a file path to this is deprecated. verify_cert_path: A filename of the CA cert bundle to use. You can specify this argument if you want to use a different CA cert bundle than the one used by botocore. endpoint_url: The complete URL to use for the constructed client. Normally, botocore will automatically construct the appropriate URL to use when communicating with a service. You can specify a complete URL (including the "http/https" scheme) to override this behavior. If this value is provided, then use_ssl is ignored. config: Advanced configuration for Botocore clients. See botocore docs for more details.

class LambdaFunction(prefect.blocks.core.Block): 
 69class LambdaFunction(Block):
 70    """Invoke a Lambda function. This block is part of the prefect-aws
 71    collection. Install prefect-aws with `pip install prefect-aws` to use this
 72    block.
 73
 74    Attributes:
 75        function_name: The name, ARN, or partial ARN of the Lambda function to
 76            run. This must be the name of a function that is already deployed
 77            to AWS Lambda.
 78        qualifier: The version or alias of the Lambda function to use when
 79            invoked. If not specified, the latest (unqualified) version of the
 80            Lambda function will be used.
 81        aws_credentials: The AWS credentials to use to connect to AWS Lambda
 82            with a default factory of AwsCredentials.
 83
 84    """
 85
 86    _block_type_name = "Lambda Function"
 87    _logo_url = "https://cdn.sanity.io/images/3ugk85nk/production/d74b16fe84ce626345adf235a47008fea2869a60-225x225.png"  # noqa
 88    _documentation_url = "https://prefecthq.github.io/prefect-aws/s3/#prefect_aws.lambda_function.LambdaFunction"  # noqa
 89
 90    function_name: str = Field(
 91        title="Function Name",
 92        description=(
 93            "The name, ARN, or partial ARN of the Lambda function to run. This"
 94            " must be the name of a function that is already deployed to AWS"
 95            " Lambda."
 96        ),
 97    )
 98    qualifier: Optional[str] = Field(
 99        default=None,
100        title="Qualifier",
101        description=(
102            "The version or alias of the Lambda function to use when invoked. "
103            "If not specified, the latest (unqualified) version of the Lambda "
104            "function will be used."
105        ),
106    )
107    aws_credentials: AwsCredentials = Field(
108        title="AWS Credentials",
109        default_factory=AwsCredentials,
110        description="The AWS credentials to invoke the Lambda with.",
111    )
112
113    class Config:
114        """Lambda's pydantic configuration."""
115
116        smart_union = True
117
118    def _get_lambda_client(self):
119        """
120        Retrieve a boto3 session and Lambda client
121        """
122        boto_session = self.aws_credentials.get_boto3_session()
123        lambda_client = boto_session.client("lambda")
124        return lambda_client
125
126    @sync_compatible
127    async def invoke(
128        self,
129        payload: dict = None,
130        invocation_type: Literal[
131            "RequestResponse", "Event", "DryRun"
132        ] = "RequestResponse",
133        tail: bool = False,
134        client_context: Optional[dict] = None,
135    ) -> dict:
136        """
137        [Invoke](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/lambda/client/invoke.html)
138        the Lambda function with the given payload.
139
140        Args:
141            payload: The payload to send to the Lambda function.
142            invocation_type: The invocation type of the Lambda function. This
143                can be one of "RequestResponse", "Event", or "DryRun". Uses
144                "RequestResponse" by default.
145            tail: If True, the response will include the base64-encoded last 4
146                KB of log data produced by the Lambda function.
147            client_context: The client context to send to the Lambda function.
148                Limited to 3583 bytes.
149
150        Returns:
151            The response from the Lambda function.
152
153        Examples:
154
155            ```python
156            from prefect_aws.lambda_function import LambdaFunction
157            from prefect_aws.credentials import AwsCredentials
158
159            credentials = AwsCredentials()
160            lambda_function = LambdaFunction(
161                function_name="test_lambda_function",
162                aws_credentials=credentials,
163            )
164            response = lambda_function.invoke(
165                payload={"foo": "bar"},
166                invocation_type="RequestResponse",
167            )
168            response["Payload"].read()
169            ```
170            ```txt
171            b'{"foo": "bar"}'
172            ```
173
174        """
175        # Add invocation arguments
176        kwargs = dict(FunctionName=self.function_name)
177
178        if payload:
179            kwargs["Payload"] = json.dumps(payload).encode()
180
181        # Let boto handle invalid invocation types
182        kwargs["InvocationType"] = invocation_type
183
184        if self.qualifier is not None:
185            kwargs["Qualifier"] = self.qualifier
186
187        if tail:
188            kwargs["LogType"] = "Tail"
189
190        if client_context is not None:
191            # For some reason this is string, but payload is bytes
192            kwargs["ClientContext"] = json.dumps(client_context)
193
194        # Get client and invoke
195        lambda_client = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(self._get_lambda_client)
196        return await run_sync_in_worker_thread(lambda_client.invoke, **kwargs)

Attributes: function_name: The name, ARN, or partial ARN of the Lambda function to run. This must be the name of a function that is already deployed to AWS Lambda. qualifier: The version or alias of the Lambda function to use when invoked. If not specified, the latest (unqualified) version of the Lambda function will be used. aws_credentials: The AWS credentials to use to connect to AWS Lambda with a default factory of AwsCredentials.

qualifier: Optional[str]
aws_credentials: AwsCredentials

250    def get_boto3_session(self) -> boto3.Session:
251        """
252        Returns an authenticated boto3 session that can be used to create clients
253        and perform object operations on MinIO server.
254
255        Example:
256            Create an S3 client from an authorized boto3 session
257
258            ```python
259            minio_credentials = MinIOCredentials(

264                service="s3",
265                endpoint_url="http://localhost:9000"
266            )
267            ```
268        """

271            self.minio_root_password.get_secret_value()
272            if self.minio_root_password
273            else None
274        )
275
276        return boto3.Session(
277            aws_access_key_id=self.minio_root_user,
278            aws_secret_access_key=minio_root_password,
279            region_name=self.region_name,
280        )

class S3Bucket(prefect.filesystems.WritableFileSystem, prefect.filesystems.WritableDeploymentStorage, prefect.blocks.abstract.ObjectStorageBlock): 
 397class S3Bucket(WritableFileSystem, WritableDeploymentStorage, ObjectStorageBlock):
 398
 399    """
 400    Block used to store data using AWS S3 or S3-compatible object storage like MinIO.
 401
 402    Attributes:
 403        bucket_name: Name of your bucket.
 404        credentials: A block containing your credentials to AWS or MinIO.
 405        bucket_folder: A default path to a folder within the S3 bucket to use
 406            for reading and writing objects.
 407    """
 408
 409    _logo_url = "https://cdn.sanity.io/images/3ugk85nk/production/d74b16fe84ce626345adf235a47008fea2869a60-225x225.png"  # noqa
 410    _block_type_name = "S3 Bucket"
 411    _documentation_url = (
 412        "https://prefecthq.github.io/prefect-aws/s3/#prefect_aws.s3.S3Bucket"  # noqa
 413    )
 414
 415    bucket_name: str = Field(default=..., description="Name of your bucket.")
 416
 417    credentials: Union[MinIOCredentials, AwsCredentials] = Field(
 418        default_factory=AwsCredentials,
 419        description="A block containing your credentials to AWS or MinIO.",
 420    )
 421
 422    bucket_folder: str = Field(
 423        default="",
 424        description=(
 425            "A default path to a folder within the S3 bucket to use "
 426            "for reading and writing objects."
 427        ),
 428    )
 429
 430    # Property to maintain compatibility with storage block based deployments
 431    @property
 432    def basepath(self) -> str:
 433        """
 434        The base path of the S3 bucket.
 435
 436        Returns:
 437            str: The base path of the S3 bucket.
 438        """
 439        return self.bucket_folder
 440
 441    @basepath.setter
 442    def basepath(self, value: str) -> None:
 443        self.bucket_folder = value
 444
 445    def _resolve_path(self, path: str) -> str:
 446        """
 447        A helper function used in write_path to join `self.basepath` and `path`.
 448
 449        Args:
 450
 451            path: Name of the key, e.g. "file1". Each object in your
 452                bucket has a unique key (or key name).
 453
 454        """
 455        # If bucket_folder provided, it means we won't write to the root dir of
 456        # the bucket. So we need to add it on the front of the path.
 457        #
 458        # AWS object key naming guidelines require '/' for bucket folders.
 459        # Get POSIX path to prevent `pathlib` from inferring '\' on Windows OS
 460        path = (
 461            (Path(self.bucket_folder) / path).as_posix() if self.bucket_folder else path
 462        )
 463
 464        return path
 465
 466    def _get_s3_client(self) -> boto3.client:
 467        """
 468        Authenticate MinIO credentials or AWS credentials and return an S3 client.
 469        This is a helper function called by read_path() or write_path().
 470        """
 471        return self.credentials.get_client("s3")
 472
 473    def _get_bucket_resource(self) -> boto3.resource:
 474        """
 475        Retrieves boto3 resource object for the configured bucket
 476        """
 477        params_override = self.credentials.aws_client_parameters.get_params_override()
 478        bucket = (
 479            self.credentials.get_boto3_session()
 480            .resource("s3", **params_override)
 481            .Bucket(self.bucket_name)
 482        )
 483        return bucket
 484
 485    @sync_compatible
 486    async def get_directory(
 487        self, from_path: Optional[str] = None, local_path: Optional[str] = None
 488    ) -> None:
 489        """
 490        Copies a folder from the configured S3 bucket to a local directory.
 491
 492        Defaults to copying the entire contents of the block's basepath to the current
 493        working directory.
 494
 495        Args:
 496            from_path: Path in S3 bucket to download from. Defaults to the block's
 497                configured basepath.
 498            local_path: Local path to download S3 contents to. Defaults to the current
 499                working directory.
 500        """
 501        bucket_folder = self.bucket_folder
 502        if from_path is None:
 503            from_path = str(bucket_folder) if bucket_folder else ""
 504
 505        if local_path is None:
 506            local_path = str(Path(".").absolute())
 507        else:
 508            local_path = str(Path(local_path).expanduser())
 509
 510        bucket = self._get_bucket_resource()
 511        for obj in bucket.objects.filter(Prefix=from_path):
 512            if obj.key[-1] == "/":
 513                # object is a folder and will be created if it contains any objects
 514                continue
 515            target = os.path.join(
 516                local_path,
 517                os.path.relpath(obj.key, from_path),
 518            )
 519            os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(target), exist_ok=True)
 520            bucket.download_file(obj.key, target)
 521
 522    @sync_compatible
 523    async def put_directory(
 524        self,
 525        local_path: Optional[str] = None,
 526        to_path: Optional[str] = None,
 527        ignore_file: Optional[str] = None,
 528    ) -> int:
 529        """
 530        Uploads a directory from a given local path to the configured S3 bucket in a
 531        given folder.
 532
 533        Defaults to uploading the entire contents the current working directory to the
 534        block's basepath.
 535
 536        Args:
 537            local_path: Path to local directory to upload from.
 538            to_path: Path in S3 bucket to upload to. Defaults to block's configured
 539                basepath.
 540            ignore_file: Path to file containing gitignore style expressions for
 541                filepaths to ignore.
 542
 543        """
 544        to_path = "" if to_path is None else to_path
 545
 546        if local_path is None:
 547            local_path = "."
 548
 549        included_files = None
 550        if ignore_file:
 551            with open(ignore_file, "r") as f:
 552                ignore_patterns = f.readlines()
 553
 554            included_files = filter_files(local_path, ignore_patterns)
 555
 556        uploaded_file_count = 0
 557        for local_file_path in Path(local_path).expanduser().rglob("*"):
 558            if (
 559                included_files is not None
 560                and str(local_file_path.relative_to(local_path)) not in included_files
 561            ):
 562                continue
 563            elif not local_file_path.is_dir():
 564                remote_file_path = Path(to_path) / local_file_path.relative_to(
 565                    local_path
 566                )
 567                with open(local_file_path, "rb") as local_file:
 568                    local_file_content = local_file.read()
 569
 570                await self.write_path(
 571                    remote_file_path.as_posix(), content=local_file_content
 572                )
 573                uploaded_file_count += 1
 574
 575        return uploaded_file_count
 576
 577    @sync_compatible
 578    async def read_path(self, path: str) -> bytes:
 579        """
 580        Read specified path from S3 and return contents. Provide the entire
 581        path to the key in S3.
 582
 583        Args:
 584            path: Entire path to (and including) the key.
 585
 586        Example:
 587            Read "subfolder/file1" contents from an S3 bucket named "bucket":
 588            ```python
 589            from prefect_aws import AwsCredentials
 590            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
 591
 592            aws_creds = AwsCredentials(
 593                aws_access_key_id=AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID,
 594                aws_secret_access_key=AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
 595            )
 596
 597            s3_bucket_block = S3Bucket(
 598                bucket_name="bucket",
 599                credentials=aws_creds,
 600                bucket_folder="subfolder"
 601            )
 602
 603            key_contents = s3_bucket_block.read_path(path="subfolder/file1")
 604            ```
 605        """
 606        path = self._resolve_path(path)
 607
 608        return await run_sync_in_worker_thread(self._read_sync, path)
 609
 610    def _read_sync(self, key: str) -> bytes:
 611        """
 612        Called by read_path(). Creates an S3 client and retrieves the
 613        contents from  a specified path.
 614        """
 615
 616        s3_client = self._get_s3_client()
 617
 618        with io.BytesIO() as stream:
 619            s3_client.download_fileobj(Bucket=self.bucket_name, Key=key, Fileobj=stream)
 620            stream.seek(0)
 621            output = stream.read()
 622            return output
 623
 624    @sync_compatible
 625    async def write_path(self, path: str, content: bytes) -> str:
 626        """
 627        Writes to an S3 bucket.
 628
 629        Args:
 630
 631            path: The key name. Each object in your bucket has a unique
 632                key (or key name).
 633            content: What you are uploading to S3.
 634
 635        Example:
 636
 637            Write data to the path `dogs/small_dogs/havanese` in an S3 Bucket:
 638            ```python
 639            from prefect_aws import MinioCredentials
 640            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
 641
 642            minio_creds = MinIOCredentials(
 643                minio_root_user = "minioadmin",
 644                minio_root_password = "minioadmin",
 645            )
 646
 647            s3_bucket_block = S3Bucket(
 648                bucket_name="bucket",
 649                minio_credentials=minio_creds,
 650                bucket_folder="dogs/smalldogs",
 651                endpoint_url="http://localhost:9000",
 652            )
 653            s3_havanese_path = s3_bucket_block.write_path(path="havanese", content=data)
 654            ```
 655        """
 656
 657        path = self._resolve_path(path)
 658
 659        await run_sync_in_worker_thread(self._write_sync, path, content)
 660
 661        return path
 662
 663    def _write_sync(self, key: str, data: bytes) -> None:
 664        """
 665        Called by write_path(). Creates an S3 client and uploads a file
 666        object.
 667        """
 668
 669        s3_client = self._get_s3_client()
 670
 671        with io.BytesIO(data) as stream:
 672            s3_client.upload_fileobj(Fileobj=stream, Bucket=self.bucket_name, Key=key)
 673
 674    # NEW BLOCK INTERFACE METHODS BELOW
 675    @staticmethod
 676    def _list_objects_sync(page_iterator: PageIterator) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
 677        """
 678        Synchronous method to collect S3 objects into a list
 679
 680        Args:
 681            page_iterator: AWS Paginator for S3 objects
 682
 683        Returns:
 684            List[Dict]: List of object information
 685        """
 686        return [
 687            content for page in page_iterator for content in page.get("Contents", [])
 688        ]
 689
 690    def _join_bucket_folder(self, bucket_path: str = "") -> str:
 691        """
 692        Joins the base bucket folder to the bucket path.
 693        NOTE: If a method reuses another method in this class, be careful to not
 694        call this  twice because it'll join the bucket folder twice.
 695        See https://github.com/PrefectHQ/prefect-aws/issues/141 for a past issue.
 696        """
 697        if not self.bucket_folder and not bucket_path:
 698            # there's a difference between "." and "", at least in the tests
 699            return ""
 700
 701        bucket_path = str(bucket_path)
 702        if self.bucket_folder != "" and bucket_path.startswith(self.bucket_folder):
 703            self.logger.info(
 704                f"Bucket path {bucket_path!r} is already prefixed with "
 705                f"bucket folder {self.bucket_folder!r}; is this intentional?"
 706            )
 707
 708        return (Path(self.bucket_folder) / bucket_path).as_posix() + (
 709            "" if not bucket_path.endswith("/") else "/"
 710        )
 711
 712    @sync_compatible
 713    async def list_objects(
 714        self,
 715        folder: str = "",
 716        delimiter: str = "",
 717        page_size: Optional[int] = None,
 718        max_items: Optional[int] = None,
 719        jmespath_query: Optional[str] = None,
 720    ) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
 721        """
 722        Args:
 723            folder: Folder to list objects from.
 724            delimiter: Character used to group keys of listed objects.
 725            page_size: Number of objects to return in each request to the AWS API.
 726            max_items: Maximum number of objects that to be returned by task.
 727            jmespath_query: Query used to filter objects based on object attributes refer to
 728                the [boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/paginators.html#filtering-results-with-jmespath)
 729                for more information on how to construct queries.
 730
 731        Returns:
 732            List of objects and their metadata in the bucket.
 733
 734        Examples:
 735            List objects under the `base_folder`.
 736            ```python
 737            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
 738
 739            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
 740            s3_bucket.list_objects("base_folder")
 741            ```
 742        """  # noqa: E501
 743        bucket_path = self._join_bucket_folder(folder)
 744        client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
 745        paginator = client.get_paginator("list_objects_v2")
 746        page_iterator = paginator.paginate(
 747            Bucket=self.bucket_name,
 748            Prefix=bucket_path,
 749            Delimiter=delimiter,
 750            PaginationConfig={"PageSize": page_size, "MaxItems": max_items},
 751        )
 752        if jmespath_query:
 753            page_iterator = page_iterator.search(f"{jmespath_query} | {{Contents: @}}")
 754
 755        self.logger.info(f"Listing objects in bucket {bucket_path}.")
 756        objects = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 757            self._list_objects_sync, page_iterator
 758        )
 759        return objects
 760
 761    @sync_compatible
 762    async def download_object_to_path(
 763        self,
 764        from_path: str,
 765        to_path: Optional[Union[str, Path]],
 766        **download_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
 767    ) -> Path:
 768        """
 769        Downloads an object from the S3 bucket to a path.
 770
 771        Args:
 772            from_path: The path to the object to download; this gets prefixed
 773                with the bucket_folder.
 774            to_path: The path to download the object to. If not provided, the
 775                object's name will be used.
 776            **download_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
 777                `Client.download_file`.
 778
 779        Returns:
 780            The absolute path that the object was downloaded to.
 781
 782        Examples:
 783            Download my_folder/notes.txt object to notes.txt.
 784            ```python
 785            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
 786
 787            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
 788            s3_bucket.download_object_to_path("my_folder/notes.txt", "notes.txt")
 789            ```
 790        """
 791        if to_path is None:
 792            to_path = Path(from_path).name
 793
 794        # making path absolute, but converting back to str here
 795        # since !r looks nicer that way and filename arg expects str
 796        to_path = str(Path(to_path).absolute())
 797        bucket_path = self._join_bucket_folder(from_path)
 798        client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
 799
 800        self.logger.debug(
 801            f"Preparing to download object from bucket {self.bucket_name!r} "
 802            f"path {bucket_path!r} to {to_path!r}."
 803        )
 804        await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 805            client.download_file,
 806            Bucket=self.bucket_name,
 807            Key=from_path,
 808            Filename=to_path,
 809            **download_kwargs,
 810        )
 811        self.logger.info(
 812            f"Downloaded object from bucket {self.bucket_name!r} path {bucket_path!r} "
 813            f"to {to_path!r}."
 814        )
 815        return Path(to_path)
 816
 817    @sync_compatible
 818    async def download_object_to_file_object(
 819        self,
 820        from_path: str,
 821        to_file_object: BinaryIO,
 822        **download_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
 823    ) -> BinaryIO:
 824        """
 825        Downloads an object from the object storage service to a file-like object,
 826        which can be a BytesIO object or a BufferedWriter.
 827
 828        Args:
 829            from_path: The path to the object to download from; this gets prefixed
 830                with the bucket_folder.
 831            to_file_object: The file-like object to download the object to.
 832            **download_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
 833                `Client.download_fileobj`.
 834
 835        Returns:
 836            The file-like object that the object was downloaded to.
 837
 838        Examples:
 839            Download my_folder/notes.txt object to a BytesIO object.
 840            ```python
 841            from io import BytesIO
 842
 843            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
 844
 845            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
 846            with BytesIO() as buf:
 847                s3_bucket.download_object_to_file_object("my_folder/notes.txt", buf)
 848            ```
 849
 850            Download my_folder/notes.txt object to a BufferedWriter.
 851            ```python
 852            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
 853
 854            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
 855            with open("notes.txt", "wb") as f:
 856                s3_bucket.download_object_to_file_object("my_folder/notes.txt", f)
 857            ```
 858        """
 859        client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
 860        bucket_path = self._join_bucket_folder(from_path)
 861
 862        self.logger.debug(
 863            f"Preparing to download object from bucket {self.bucket_name!r} "
 864            f"path {bucket_path!r} to file object."
 865        )
 866        await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 867            client.download_fileobj,
 868            Bucket=self.bucket_name,
 869            Key=bucket_path,
 870            Fileobj=to_file_object,
 871            **download_kwargs,
 872        )
 873        self.logger.info(
 874            f"Downloaded object from bucket {self.bucket_name!r} path {bucket_path!r} "
 875            "to file object."
 876        )
 877        return to_file_object
 878
 879    @sync_compatible
 880    async def download_folder_to_path(
 881        self,
 882        from_folder: str,
 883        to_folder: Optional[Union[str, Path]] = None,
 884        **download_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
 885    ) -> Path:
 886        """
 887        Downloads objects *within* a folder (excluding the folder itself)
 888        from the S3 bucket to a folder.
 889
 890        Args:
 891            from_folder: The path to the folder to download from.
 892            to_folder: The path to download the folder to.
 893            **download_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
 894                `Client.download_file`.
 895
 896        Returns:
 897            The absolute path that the folder was downloaded to.
 898
 899        Examples:
 900            Download my_folder to a local folder named my_folder.
 901            ```python
 902            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
 903
 904            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
 905            s3_bucket.download_folder_to_path("my_folder", "my_folder")
 906            ```
 907        """
 908        if to_folder is None:
 909            to_folder = ""
 910        to_folder = Path(to_folder).absolute()
 911
 912        client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
 913        objects = await self.list_objects(folder=from_folder)
 914
 915        # do not call self._join_bucket_folder for filter
 916        # because it's built-in to that method already!
 917        # however, we still need to do it because we're using relative_to
 918        bucket_folder = self._join_bucket_folder(from_folder)
 919
 920        async_coros = []
 921        for object in objects:
 922            bucket_path = Path(object["Key"]).relative_to(bucket_folder)
 923            # this skips the actual directory itself, e.g.
 924            # `my_folder/` will be skipped
 925            # `my_folder/notes.txt` will be downloaded
 926            if bucket_path.is_dir():
 927                continue
 928            to_path = to_folder / bucket_path
 929            to_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
 930            to_path = str(to_path)  # must be string
 931            self.logger.info(
 932                f"Downloading object from bucket {self.bucket_name!r} path "
 933                f"{bucket_path.as_posix()!r} to {to_path!r}."
 934            )
 935            async_coros.append(
 936                run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 937                    client.download_file,
 938                    Bucket=self.bucket_name,
 939                    Key=object["Key"],
 940                    Filename=to_path,
 941                    **download_kwargs,
 942                )
 943            )
 944        await asyncio.gather(*async_coros)
 945
 946        return Path(to_folder)
 947
 948    @sync_compatible
 949    async def stream_from(
 950        self,
 951        bucket: "S3Bucket",
 952        from_path: str,
 953        to_path: Optional[str] = None,
 954        **upload_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
 955    ) -> str:
 956        """Streams an object from another bucket to this bucket. Requires the
 957        object to be downloaded and uploaded in chunks. If `self`'s credentials
 958        allow for writes to the other bucket, try using `S3Bucket.copy_object`.
 959
 960        Args:
 961            bucket: The bucket to stream from.
 962            from_path: The path of the object to stream.
 963            to_path: The path to stream the object to. Defaults to the object's name.
 964            **upload_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
 965                `Client.upload_fileobj`.
 966
 967        Returns:
 968            The path that the object was uploaded to.
 969
 970        Examples:
 971            Stream notes.txt from your-bucket/notes.txt to my-bucket/landed/notes.txt.
 972
 973            ```python
 974            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
 975
 976            your_s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("your-bucket")
 977            my_s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
 978
 979            my_s3_bucket.stream_from(
 980                your_s3_bucket,
 981                "notes.txt",
 982                to_path="landed/notes.txt"
 983            )
 984            ```
 985
 986        """
 987        if to_path is None:
 988            to_path = Path(from_path).name
 989
 990        # Get the source object's StreamingBody
 991        from_path: str = bucket._join_bucket_folder(from_path)
 992        from_client = bucket.credentials.get_s3_client()
 993        obj = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 994            from_client.get_object, Bucket=bucket.bucket_name, Key=from_path
 995        )
 996        body: StreamingBody = obj["Body"]
 997
 998        # Upload the StreamingBody to this bucket
 999        bucket_path = str(self._join_bucket_folder(to_path))
1000        to_client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
1001        await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
1002            to_client.upload_fileobj,
1003            Fileobj=body,
1004            Bucket=self.bucket_name,
1005            Key=bucket_path,
1006            **upload_kwargs,
1007        )
1008        self.logger.info(
1009            f"Streamed s3://{bucket.bucket_name}/{from_path} to the bucket "
1010            f"{self.bucket_name!r} path {bucket_path!r}."
1011        )
1012        return bucket_path
1013
1014    @sync_compatible
1015    async def upload_from_path(
1016        self,
1017        from_path: Union[str, Path],
1018        to_path: Optional[str] = None,
1019        **upload_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
1020    ) -> str:
1021        """
1022        Uploads an object from a path to the S3 bucket.
1023
1024        Args:
1025            from_path: The path to the file to upload from.
1026            to_path: The path to upload the file to.
1027            **upload_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to `Client.upload`.
1028
1029        Returns:
1030            The path that the object was uploaded to.
1031
1032        Examples:
1033            Upload notes.txt to my_folder/notes.txt.
1034            ```python
1035            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1036
1037            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1038            s3_bucket.upload_from_path("notes.txt", "my_folder/notes.txt")
1039            ```
1040        """
1041        from_path = str(Path(from_path).absolute())
1042        if to_path is None:
1043            to_path = Path(from_path).name
1044
1045        bucket_path = str(self._join_bucket_folder(to_path))
1046        client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
1047
1048        await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
1049            client.upload_file,
1050            Filename=from_path,
1051            Bucket=self.bucket_name,
1052            Key=bucket_path,
1053            **upload_kwargs,
1054        )
1055        self.logger.info(
1056            f"Uploaded from {from_path!r} to the bucket "
1057            f"{self.bucket_name!r} path {bucket_path!r}."
1058        )
1059        return bucket_path

1061    @sync_compatible
1062    async def upload_from_file_object(
1063        self, from_file_object: BinaryIO, to_path: str, **upload_kwargs: Dict[str, Any]
1064    ) -> str:
1065        """
1066        Uploads an object to the S3 bucket from a file-like object,
1067        which can be a BytesIO object or a BufferedReader.
1068
1069        Args:
1070            from_file_object: The file-like object to upload from.
1071            to_path: The path to upload the object to.
1072            **upload_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
1073                `Client.upload_fileobj`.
1074
1075        Returns:
1076            The path that the object was uploaded to.
1077
1078        Examples:
1079            Upload BytesIO object to my_folder/notes.txt.
1080            ```python
1081            from io import BytesIO
1082
1083            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1084
1085            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1086            with open("notes.txt", "rb") as f:
1087                s3_bucket.upload_from_file_object(f, "my_folder/notes.txt")
1088            ```
1089
1090            Upload BufferedReader object to my_folder/notes.txt.
1091            ```python
1092            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1093
1094            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1095            with open("notes.txt", "rb") as f:
1096                s3_bucket.upload_from_file_object(
1097                    f, "my_folder/notes.txt"
1098                )
1099            ```
1100        """
1101        bucket_path = str(self._join_bucket_folder(to_path))
1102        client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
1103        await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
1104            client.upload_fileobj,
1105            Fileobj=from_file_object,
1106            Bucket=self.bucket_name,
1107            Key=bucket_path,
1108            **upload_kwargs,
1109        )
1110        self.logger.info(
1111            "Uploaded from file object to the bucket "
1112            f"{self.bucket_name!r} path {bucket_path!r}."
1113        )
1114        return bucket_path
1115
1116    @sync_compatible
1117    async def upload_from_folder(
1118        self,
1119        from_folder: Union[str, Path],
1120        to_folder: Optional[str] = None,
1121        **upload_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
1122    ) -> str:
1123        """
1124        Uploads files *within* a folder (excluding the folder itself)
1125        to the object storage service folder.
1126
1127        Args:
1128            from_folder: The path to the folder to upload from.
1129            to_folder: The path to upload the folder to.
1130            **upload_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
1131                `Client.upload_fileobj`.
1132
1133        Returns:
1134            The path that the folder was uploaded to.
1135
1136        Examples:
1137            Upload contents from my_folder to new_folder.
1138            ```python
1139            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1140
1141            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1142            s3_bucket.upload_from_folder("my_folder", "new_folder")
1143            ```
1144        """
1145        from_folder = Path(from_folder)
1146        bucket_folder = self._join_bucket_folder(to_folder or "")
1147
1148        num_uploaded = 0
1149        client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
1150
1151        async_coros = []
1152        for from_path in from_folder.rglob("**/*"):
1153            # this skips the actual directory itself, e.g.
1154            # `my_folder/` will be skipped
1155            # `my_folder/notes.txt` will be uploaded
1156            if from_path.is_dir():
1157                continue
1158            bucket_path = (
1159                Path(bucket_folder) / from_path.relative_to(from_folder)
1160            ).as_posix()
1161            self.logger.info(
1162                f"Uploading from {str(from_path)!r} to the bucket "
1163                f"{self.bucket_name!r} path {bucket_path!r}."
1164            )
1165            async_coros.append(
1166                run_sync_in_worker_thread(
1167                    client.upload_file,
1168                    Filename=str(from_path),
1169                    Bucket=self.bucket_name,
1170                    Key=bucket_path,
1171                    **upload_kwargs,
1172                )
1173            )
1174            num_uploaded += 1
1175        await asyncio.gather(*async_coros)
1176
1177        if num_uploaded == 0:
1178            self.logger.warning(f"No files were uploaded from {str(from_folder)!r}.")
1179        else:
1180            self.logger.info(
1181                f"Uploaded {num_uploaded} files from {str(from_folder)!r} to "
1182                f"the bucket {self.bucket_name!r} path {bucket_path!r}"
1183            )
1184
1185        return to_folder
1186
1187    @sync_compatible
1188    async def copy_object(
1189        self,
1190        from_path: Union[str, Path],
1191        to_path: Union[str, Path],
1192        to_bucket: Optional[Union["S3Bucket", str]] = None,
1193        **copy_kwargs,
1194    ) -> str:
1195        """Uses S3's internal
1196        [CopyObject](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/API_CopyObject.html)
1197        to copy objects within or between buckets. To copy objects between buckets,
1198        `self`'s credentials must have permission to read the source object and write
1199        to the target object. If the credentials do not have those permissions, try
1200        using `S3Bucket.stream_from`.
1201
1202        Args:
1203            from_path: The path of the object to copy.
1204            to_path: The path to copy the object to.
1205            to_bucket: The bucket to copy to. Defaults to the current bucket.
1206            **copy_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
1207                `S3Client.copy_object`.
1208
1209        Returns:
1210            The path that the object was copied to. Excludes the bucket name.
1211
1212        Examples:
1213
1214            Copy notes.txt from my_folder/notes.txt to my_folder/notes_copy.txt.
1215
1216            ```python
1217            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1218
1219            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1220            s3_bucket.copy_object("my_folder/notes.txt", "my_folder/notes_copy.txt")
1221            ```
1222
1223            Copy notes.txt from my_folder/notes.txt to my_folder/notes_copy.txt in
1224            another bucket.
1225
1226            ```python
1227            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1228
1229            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1230            s3_bucket.copy_object(
1231                "my_folder/notes.txt",
1232                "my_folder/notes_copy.txt",
1233                to_bucket="other-bucket"
1234            )
1235            ```
1236        """
1237        s3_client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
1238
1239        source_bucket_name = self.bucket_name
1240        source_path = self._resolve_path(Path(from_path).as_posix())
1241
1242        # Default to copying within the same bucket
1243        to_bucket = to_bucket or self
1244
1245        target_bucket_name: str
1246        target_path: str
1247        if isinstance(to_bucket, S3Bucket):
1248            target_bucket_name = to_bucket.bucket_name
1249            target_path = to_bucket._resolve_path(Path(to_path).as_posix())
1250        elif isinstance(to_bucket, str):
1251            target_bucket_name = to_bucket
1252            target_path = Path(to_path).as_posix()
1253        else:
1254            raise TypeError(
1255                f"to_bucket must be a string or S3Bucket, not {type(to_bucket)}"
1256            )
1257
1258        self.logger.info(
1259            "Copying object from bucket %s with key %s to bucket %s with key %s",
1260            source_bucket_name,
1261            source_path,
1262            target_bucket_name,
1263            target_path,
1264        )
1265
1266        s3_client.copy_object(
1267            CopySource={"Bucket": source_bucket_name, "Key": source_path},
1268            Bucket=target_bucket_name,
1269            Key=target_path,
1270            **copy_kwargs,
1271        )
1272
1273        return target_path
1274
1275    @sync_compatible
1276    async def move_object(
1277        self,
1278        from_path: Union[str, Path],
1279        to_path: Union[str, Path],
1280        to_bucket: Optional[Union["S3Bucket", str]] = None,
1281    ) -> str:
1282        """Uses S3's internal CopyObject and DeleteObject to move objects within or
1283        between buckets. To move objects between buckets, `self`'s credentials must
1284        have permission to read and delete the source object and write to the target
1285        object. If the credentials do not have those permissions, this method will
1286        raise an error. If the credentials have permission to read the source object
1287        but not delete it, the object will be copied but not deleted.
1288
1289        Args:
1290            from_path: The path of the object to move.
1291            to_path: The path to move the object to.
1292            to_bucket: The bucket to move to. Defaults to the current bucket.
1293
1294        Returns:
1295            The path that the object was moved to. Excludes the bucket name.
1296
1297        Examples:
1298
1299            Move notes.txt from my_folder/notes.txt to my_folder/notes_copy.txt.
1300
1301            ```python
1302            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1303
1304            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1305            s3_bucket.move_object("my_folder/notes.txt", "my_folder/notes_copy.txt")
1306            ```
1307
1308            Move notes.txt from my_folder/notes.txt to my_folder/notes_copy.txt in
1309            another bucket.
1310
1311            ```python
1312            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1313
1314            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1315            s3_bucket.move_object(
1316                "my_folder/notes.txt",
1317                "my_folder/notes_copy.txt",
1318                to_bucket="other-bucket"
1319            )
1320            ```
1321        """
1322        s3_client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
1323
1324        source_bucket_name = self.bucket_name
1325        source_path = self._resolve_path(Path(from_path).as_posix())
1326
1327        # Default to moving within the same bucket
1328        to_bucket = to_bucket or self
1329
1330        target_bucket_name: str
1331        target_path: str
1332        if isinstance(to_bucket, S3Bucket):
1333            target_bucket_name = to_bucket.bucket_name
1334            target_path = to_bucket._resolve_path(Path(to_path).as_posix())
1335        elif isinstance(to_bucket, str):
1336            target_bucket_name = to_bucket
1337            target_path = Path(to_path).as_posix()
1338        else:
1339            raise TypeError(
1340                f"to_bucket must be a string or S3Bucket, not {type(to_bucket)}"
1341            )
1342
1343        self.logger.info(
1344            "Moving object from s3://%s/%s to s3://%s/%s",
1345            source_bucket_name,
1346            source_path,
1347            target_bucket_name,
1348            target_path,
1349        )
1350
1351        # If invalid, should error and prevent next operation
1352        s3_client.copy(
1353            CopySource={"Bucket": source_bucket_name, "Key": source_path},
1354            Bucket=target_bucket_name,
1355            Key=target_path,
1356        )
1357        s3_client.delete_object(Bucket=source_bucket_name, Key=source_path)
1358        return target_path

Block used to store data using AWS S3 or S3-compatible object storage like MinIO.

Attributes: bucket_name: Name of your bucket. credentials: A block containing your credentials to AWS or MinIO. bucket_folder: A default path to a folder within the S3 bucket to use for reading and writing objects.

bucket_name: str
credentials: Union[MinIOCredentials, AwsCredentials]
bucket_folder: str

433        """
434        The base path of the S3 bucket.
435
436        Returns:
437            str: The base path of the S3 bucket.
438        """
439        return self.bucket_folder

@sync_compatible
async def get_directory( self, from_path: Optional[str] = None, local_path: Optional[str] = None) -> None: 
485    @sync_compatible
486    async def get_directory(
487        self, from_path: Optional[str] = None, local_path: Optional[str] = None
488    ) -> None:
489        """
490        Copies a folder from the configured S3 bucket to a local directory.
491
492        Defaults to copying the entire contents of the block's basepath to the current
493        working directory.
494
495        Args:
496            from_path: Path in S3 bucket to download from. Defaults to the block's
497                configured basepath.
498            local_path: Local path to download S3 contents to. Defaults to the current
499                working directory.
500        """
501        bucket_folder = self.bucket_folder
502        if from_path is None:
503            from_path = str(bucket_folder) if bucket_folder else ""
504
505        if local_path is None:
506            local_path = str(Path(".").absolute())
507        else:
508            local_path = str(Path(local_path).expanduser())
509
510        bucket = self._get_bucket_resource()
511        for obj in bucket.objects.filter(Prefix=from_path):
512            if obj.key[-1] == "/":
513                # object is a folder and will be created if it contains any objects
514                continue
515            target = os.path.join(
516                local_path,
517                os.path.relpath(obj.key, from_path),
518            )
519            os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(target), exist_ok=True)
520            bucket.download_file(obj.key, target)

Copies a folder from the configured S3 bucket to a local directory.

Defaults to copying the entire contents of the block's basepath to the current working directory.

Args: from_path: Path in S3 bucket to download from. Defaults to the block's configured basepath. local_path: Local path to download S3 contents to. Defaults to the current working directory.

@sync_compatible
async def put_directory( self, local_path: Optional[str] = None, to_path: Optional[str] = None, ignore_file: Optional[str] = None) -> int: 
522    @sync_compatible
523    async def put_directory(
524        self,
525        local_path: Optional[str] = None,
526        to_path: Optional[str] = None,
527        ignore_file: Optional[str] = None,
528    ) -> int:
529        """
530        Uploads a directory from a given local path to the configured S3 bucket in a
531        given folder.
532
533        Defaults to uploading the entire contents the current working directory to the
534        block's basepath.
535
536        Args:
537            local_path: Path to local directory to upload from.
538            to_path: Path in S3 bucket to upload to. Defaults to block's configured
539                basepath.
540            ignore_file: Path to file containing gitignore style expressions for
541                filepaths to ignore.
542
543        """
544        to_path = "" if to_path is None else to_path
545
546        if local_path is None:
547            local_path = "."
548
549        included_files = None
550        if ignore_file:
551            with open(ignore_file, "r") as f:
552                ignore_patterns = f.readlines()
553
554            included_files = filter_files(local_path, ignore_patterns)
555
556        uploaded_file_count = 0
557        for local_file_path in Path(local_path).expanduser().rglob("*"):
558            if (
559                included_files is not None
560                and str(local_file_path.relative_to(local_path)) not in included_files
561            ):
562                continue
563            elif not local_file_path.is_dir():
564                remote_file_path = Path(to_path) / local_file_path.relative_to(
565                    local_path
566                )
567                with open(local_file_path, "rb") as local_file:
568                    local_file_content = local_file.read()
569
570                await self.write_path(
571                    remote_file_path.as_posix(), content=local_file_content
572                )
573                uploaded_file_count += 1
574
575        return uploaded_file_count

Uploads a directory from a given local path to the configured S3 bucket in a given folder.

Defaults to uploading the entire contents the current working directory to the block's basepath.

Args: local_path: Path to local directory to upload from. to_path: Path in S3 bucket to upload to. Defaults to block's configured basepath. ignore_file: Path to file containing gitignore style expressions for filepaths to ignore.

@sync_compatible
async def list_objects( self, folder: str = '', delimiter: str = '', page_size: Optional[int] = None, max_items: Optional[int] = None, jmespath_query: Optional[str] = None) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]: 
712    @sync_compatible
713    async def list_objects(
714        self,
715        folder: str = "",
716        delimiter: str = "",
717        page_size: Optional[int] = None,
718        max_items: Optional[int] = None,
719        jmespath_query: Optional[str] = None,
720    ) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
721        """
722        Args:
723            folder: Folder to list objects from.
724            delimiter: Character used to group keys of listed objects.
725            page_size: Number of objects to return in each request to the AWS API.
726            max_items: Maximum number of objects that to be returned by task.
727            jmespath_query: Query used to filter objects based on object attributes refer to
728                the [boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/paginators.html#filtering-results-with-jmespath)
729                for more information on how to construct queries.
730
731        Returns:
732            List of objects and their metadata in the bucket.
733
734        Examples:
735            List objects under the `base_folder`.
736            ```python
737            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
738
739            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
740            s3_bucket.list_objects("base_folder")
741            ```
742        """  # noqa: E501
743        bucket_path = self._join_bucket_folder(folder)
744        client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
745        paginator = client.get_paginator("list_objects_v2")
746        page_iterator = paginator.paginate(
747            Bucket=self.bucket_name,
748            Prefix=bucket_path,
749            Delimiter=delimiter,
750            PaginationConfig={"PageSize": page_size, "MaxItems": max_items},
751        )
752        if jmespath_query:
753            page_iterator = page_iterator.search(f"{jmespath_query} | {{Contents: @}}")
754
755        self.logger.info(f"Listing objects in bucket {bucket_path}.")
756        objects = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
757            self._list_objects_sync, page_iterator
758        )
759        return objects

Args: folder: Folder to list objects from. delimiter: Character used to group keys of listed objects. page_size: Number of objects to return in each request to the AWS API. max_items: Maximum number of objects that to be returned by task. jmespath_query: Query used to filter objects based on object attributes refer to the boto3 docs for more information on how to construct queries.

Returns: List of objects and their metadata in the bucket.

Examples: List objects under the base_folder. 

from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
 

    s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
    s3_bucket.list_objects("base_folder")

@sync_compatible
async def download_object_to_path( self, from_path: str, to_path: Union[str, pathlib.Path, NoneType], **download_kwargs: Dict[str, Any]) -> pathlib.Path: 
761    @sync_compatible
762    async def download_object_to_path(
763        self,
764        from_path: str,
765        to_path: Optional[Union[str, Path]],
766        **download_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
767    ) -> Path:
768        """
769        Downloads an object from the S3 bucket to a path.
770
771        Args:
772            from_path: The path to the object to download; this gets prefixed
773                with the bucket_folder.
774            to_path: The path to download the object to. If not provided, the
775                object's name will be used.
776            **download_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
777                `Client.download_file`.
778
779        Returns:
780            The absolute path that the object was downloaded to.
781
782        Examples:
783            Download my_folder/notes.txt object to notes.txt.
784            ```python
785            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
786
787            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
788            s3_bucket.download_object_to_path("my_folder/notes.txt", "notes.txt")
789            ```
790        """
791        if to_path is None:
792            to_path = Path(from_path).name
793
794        # making path absolute, but converting back to str here
795        # since !r looks nicer that way and filename arg expects str
796        to_path = str(Path(to_path).absolute())
797        bucket_path = self._join_bucket_folder(from_path)
798        client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
799
800        self.logger.debug(
801            f"Preparing to download object from bucket {self.bucket_name!r} "
802            f"path {bucket_path!r} to {to_path!r}."
803        )
804        await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
805            client.download_file,
806            Bucket=self.bucket_name,
807            Key=from_path,
808            Filename=to_path,
809            **download_kwargs,
810        )
811        self.logger.info(
812            f"Downloaded object from bucket {self.bucket_name!r} path {bucket_path!r} "
813            f"to {to_path!r}."
814        )
815        return Path(to_path)

@sync_compatible
async def download_folder_to_path( self, from_folder: str, to_folder: Union[str, pathlib.Path, NoneType] = None, **download_kwargs: Dict[str, Any]) -> pathlib.Path: 
879    @sync_compatible
880    async def download_folder_to_path(
881        self,
882        from_folder: str,
883        to_folder: Optional[Union[str, Path]] = None,
884        **download_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
885    ) -> Path:
886        """
887        Downloads objects *within* a folder (excluding the folder itself)
888        from the S3 bucket to a folder.
889
890        Args:
891            from_folder: The path to the folder to download from.
892            to_folder: The path to download the folder to.
893            **download_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
894                `Client.download_file`.
895
896        Returns:
897            The absolute path that the folder was downloaded to.
898
899        Examples:
900            Download my_folder to a local folder named my_folder.
901            ```python
902            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
903
904            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
905            s3_bucket.download_folder_to_path("my_folder", "my_folder")
906            ```
907        """
908        if to_folder is None:
909            to_folder = ""
910        to_folder = Path(to_folder).absolute()
911
912        client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
913        objects = await self.list_objects(folder=from_folder)
914
915        # do not call self._join_bucket_folder for filter
916        # because it's built-in to that method already!
917        # however, we still need to do it because we're using relative_to
918        bucket_folder = self._join_bucket_folder(from_folder)
919
920        async_coros = []
921        for object in objects:
922            bucket_path = Path(object["Key"]).relative_to(bucket_folder)
923            # this skips the actual directory itself, e.g.
924            # `my_folder/` will be skipped
925            # `my_folder/notes.txt` will be downloaded
926            if bucket_path.is_dir():
927                continue
928            to_path = to_folder / bucket_path
929            to_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
930            to_path = str(to_path)  # must be string
931            self.logger.info(
932                f"Downloading object from bucket {self.bucket_name!r} path "
933                f"{bucket_path.as_posix()!r} to {to_path!r}."
934            )
935            async_coros.append(
936                run_sync_in_worker_thread(
937                    client.download_file,
938                    Bucket=self.bucket_name,
939                    Key=object["Key"],
940                    Filename=to_path,
941                    **download_kwargs,
942                )
943            )
944        await asyncio.gather(*async_coros)
945
946        return Path(to_folder)

@sync_compatible
async def stream_from( self, bucket: S3Bucket, from_path: str, to_path: Optional[str] = None, **upload_kwargs: Dict[str, Any]) -> str: 
 948    @sync_compatible
 949    async def stream_from(
 950        self,
 951        bucket: "S3Bucket",
 952        from_path: str,
 953        to_path: Optional[str] = None,
 954        **upload_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
 955    ) -> str:
 956        """Streams an object from another bucket to this bucket. Requires the
 957        object to be downloaded and uploaded in chunks. If `self`'s credentials
 958        allow for writes to the other bucket, try using `S3Bucket.copy_object`.
 959
 960        Args:
 961            bucket: The bucket to stream from.
 962            from_path: The path of the object to stream.
 963            to_path: The path to stream the object to. Defaults to the object's name.
 964            **upload_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
 965                `Client.upload_fileobj`.
 966
 967        Returns:
 968            The path that the object was uploaded to.
 969
 970        Examples:
 971            Stream notes.txt from your-bucket/notes.txt to my-bucket/landed/notes.txt.
 972
 973            ```python
 974            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
 975
 976            your_s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("your-bucket")
 977            my_s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
 978
 979            my_s3_bucket.stream_from(
 980                your_s3_bucket,
 981                "notes.txt",
 982                to_path="landed/notes.txt"
 983            )
 984            ```
 985
 986        """
 987        if to_path is None:
 988            to_path = Path(from_path).name
 989
 990        # Get the source object's StreamingBody
 991        from_path: str = bucket._join_bucket_folder(from_path)
 992        from_client = bucket.credentials.get_s3_client()
 993        obj = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 994            from_client.get_object, Bucket=bucket.bucket_name, Key=from_path
 995        )
 996        body: StreamingBody = obj["Body"]
 997
 998        # Upload the StreamingBody to this bucket
 999        bucket_path = str(self._join_bucket_folder(to_path))
1000        to_client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
1001        await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
1002            to_client.upload_fileobj,
1003            Fileobj=body,
1004            Bucket=self.bucket_name,
1005            Key=bucket_path,
1006            **upload_kwargs,
1007        )
1008        self.logger.info(
1009            f"Streamed s3://{bucket.bucket_name}/{from_path} to the bucket "
1010            f"{self.bucket_name!r} path {bucket_path!r}."
1011        )
1012        return bucket_path
