@sync_compatible
async def upload_from_folder( self, from_folder: Union[str, pathlib.Path], to_folder: Optional[str] = None, **upload_kwargs: Dict[str, Any]) -> str: 
1116    @sync_compatible
1117    async def upload_from_folder(
1118        self,
1119        from_folder: Union[str, Path],
1120        to_folder: Optional[str] = None,
1121        **upload_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
1122    ) -> str:
1123        """
1124        Uploads files *within* a folder (excluding the folder itself)
1125        to the object storage service folder.
1126
1127        Args:
1128            from_folder: The path to the folder to upload from.
1129            to_folder: The path to upload the folder to.
1130            **upload_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
1131                `Client.upload_fileobj`.
1132
1133        Returns:
1134            The path that the folder was uploaded to.
1135
1136        Examples:
1137            Upload contents from my_folder to new_folder.
1138            ```python
1139            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1140
1141            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1142            s3_bucket.upload_from_folder("my_folder", "new_folder")
1143            ```
1144        """
1145        from_folder = Path(from_folder)
1146        bucket_folder = self._join_bucket_folder(to_folder or "")
1147
1148        num_uploaded = 0
1149        client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
1150
1151        async_coros = []
1152        for from_path in from_folder.rglob("**/*"):
1153            # this skips the actual directory itself, e.g.
1154            # `my_folder/` will be skipped
1155            # `my_folder/notes.txt` will be uploaded
1156            if from_path.is_dir():
1157                continue
1158            bucket_path = (
1159                Path(bucket_folder) / from_path.relative_to(from_folder)
1160            ).as_posix()
1161            self.logger.info(
1162                f"Uploading from {str(from_path)!r} to the bucket "
1163                f"{self.bucket_name!r} path {bucket_path!r}."
1164            )
1165            async_coros.append(
1166                run_sync_in_worker_thread(
1167                    client.upload_file,
1168                    Filename=str(from_path),
1169                    Bucket=self.bucket_name,
1170                    Key=bucket_path,
1171                    **upload_kwargs,
1172                )
1173            )
1174            num_uploaded += 1
1175        await asyncio.gather(*async_coros)
1176
1177        if num_uploaded == 0:
1178            self.logger.warning(f"No files were uploaded from {str(from_folder)!r}.")
1179        else:
1180            self.logger.info(
1181                f"Uploaded {num_uploaded} files from {str(from_folder)!r} to "
1182                f"the bucket {self.bucket_name!r} path {bucket_path!r}"
1183            )
1184
1185        return to_folder

Uploads files within a folder (excluding the folder itself) to the object storage service folder.

Args: from_folder: The path to the folder to upload from. to_folder: The path to upload the folder to. **upload_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to Client.upload_fileobj.

Returns: The path that the folder was uploaded to.

Examples: Upload contents from my_folder to new_folder. 

from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
 

    s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
    s3_bucket.upload_from_folder("my_folder", "new_folder")

@sync_compatible
async def copy_object( self, from_path: Union[str, pathlib.Path], to_path: Union[str, pathlib.Path], to_bucket: Union[S3Bucket, str, NoneType] = None, **copy_kwargs) -> str: 
1187    @sync_compatible
1188    async def copy_object(
1189        self,
1190        from_path: Union[str, Path],
1191        to_path: Union[str, Path],
1192        to_bucket: Optional[Union["S3Bucket", str]] = None,
1193        **copy_kwargs,
1194    ) -> str:
1195        """Uses S3's internal
1196        [CopyObject](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/API_CopyObject.html)
1197        to copy objects within or between buckets. To copy objects between buckets,
1198        `self`'s credentials must have permission to read the source object and write
1199        to the target object. If the credentials do not have those permissions, try
1200        using `S3Bucket.stream_from`.
1201
1202        Args:
1203            from_path: The path of the object to copy.
1204            to_path: The path to copy the object to.
1205            to_bucket: The bucket to copy to. Defaults to the current bucket.
1206            **copy_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
1207                `S3Client.copy_object`.
1208
1209        Returns:
1210            The path that the object was copied to. Excludes the bucket name.
1211
1212        Examples:
1213
1214            Copy notes.txt from my_folder/notes.txt to my_folder/notes_copy.txt.
1215
1216            ```python
1217            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1218
1219            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1220            s3_bucket.copy_object("my_folder/notes.txt", "my_folder/notes_copy.txt")
1221            ```
1222
1223            Copy notes.txt from my_folder/notes.txt to my_folder/notes_copy.txt in
1224            another bucket.
1225
1226            ```python
1227            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1228
1229            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1230            s3_bucket.copy_object(
1231                "my_folder/notes.txt",
1232                "my_folder/notes_copy.txt",
1233                to_bucket="other-bucket"
1234            )
1235            ```
1236        """
1237        s3_client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
1238
1239        source_bucket_name = self.bucket_name
1240        source_path = self._resolve_path(Path(from_path).as_posix())
1241
1242        # Default to copying within the same bucket
1243        to_bucket = to_bucket or self
1244
1245        target_bucket_name: str
1246        target_path: str
1247        if isinstance(to_bucket, S3Bucket):
1248            target_bucket_name = to_bucket.bucket_name
1249            target_path = to_bucket._resolve_path(Path(to_path).as_posix())
1250        elif isinstance(to_bucket, str):
1251            target_bucket_name = to_bucket
1252            target_path = Path(to_path).as_posix()
1253        else:
1254            raise TypeError(
1255                f"to_bucket must be a string or S3Bucket, not {type(to_bucket)}"
1256            )
1257
1258        self.logger.info(
1259            "Copying object from bucket %s with key %s to bucket %s with key %s",
1260            source_bucket_name,
1261            source_path,
1262            target_bucket_name,
1263            target_path,
1264        )
1265
1266        s3_client.copy_object(
1267            CopySource={"Bucket": source_bucket_name, "Key": source_path},
1268            Bucket=target_bucket_name,
1269            Key=target_path,
1270            **copy_kwargs,
1271        )
1272
1273        return target_path

Uses S3's internal CopyObject to copy objects within or between buckets. To copy objects between buckets, self's credentials must have permission to read the source object and write to the target object. If the credentials do not have those permissions, try using S3Bucket.stream_from.

Args: from_path: The path of the object to copy. to_path: The path to copy the object to. to_bucket: The bucket to copy to. Defaults to the current bucket. **copy_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to S3Client.copy_object.

@sync_compatible
async def move_object( self, from_path: Union[str, pathlib.Path], to_path: Union[str, pathlib.Path], to_bucket: Union[S3Bucket, str, NoneType] = None) -> str: 
1275    @sync_compatible
1276    async def move_object(
1277        self,

1282        """Uses S3's internal CopyObject and DeleteObject to move objects within or
1283        between buckets. To move objects between buckets, `self`'s credentials must
1284        have permission to read and delete the source object and write to the target
1285        object. If the credentials do not have those permissions, this method will

1287        but not delete it, the object will be copied but not deleted.
1288

1305            s3_bucket.move_object("my_folder/notes.txt", "my_folder/notes_copy.txt")
1306            ```
1307
1308            Move notes.txt from my_folder/notes.txt to my_folder/notes_copy.txt in
1309            another bucket.
1310
1311            ```python
1312            from prefect_aws.s3 import S3Bucket
1313
1314            s3_bucket = S3Bucket.load("my-bucket")
1315            s3_bucket.move_object(
1316                "my_folder/notes.txt",
1317                "my_folder/notes_copy.txt",
1318                to_bucket="other-bucket"
1319            )
1320            ```
1321        """
1322        s3_client = self.credentials.get_s3_client()
1323
1324        source_bucket_name = self.bucket_name
1325        source_path = self._resolve_path(Path(from_path).as_posix())
1326
1327        # Default to moving within the same bucket
1328        to_bucket = to_bucket or self
1329
1330        target_bucket_name: str
1331        target_path: str
1332        if isinstance(to_bucket, S3Bucket):
1333            target_bucket_name = to_bucket.bucket_name
1334            target_path = to_bucket._resolve_path(Path(to_path).as_posix())
1335        elif isinstance(to_bucket, str):
1336            target_bucket_name = to_bucket
1337            target_path = Path(to_path).as_posix()
1338        else:
1339            raise TypeError(
1340                f"to_bucket must be a string or S3Bucket, not {type(to_bucket)}"
1341            )
1342
1343        self.logger.info(
1344            "Moving object from s3://%s/%s to s3://%s/%s",
1345            source_bucket_name,
1346            source_path,
1347            target_bucket_name,
1348            target_path,
1349        )
1350
1351        # If invalid, should error and prevent next operation
1352        s3_client.copy(
1353            CopySource={"Bucket": source_bucket_name, "Key": source_path},
1354            Bucket=target_bucket_name,
1355            Key=target_path,
1356        )
1357        s3_client.delete_object(Bucket=source_bucket_name, Key=source_path)
1358        return target_path

Uses S3's internal CopyObject and DeleteObject to move objects within or between buckets. To move objects between buckets, self's credentials must have permission to read and delete the source object and write to the target object. If the credentials do not have those permissions, this method will raise an error. If the credentials have permission to read the source object but not delete it, the object will be copied but not deleted.

Args: from_path: The path of the object to move. to_path: The path to move the object to. to_bucket: The bucket to move to. Defaults to the current bucket.

Returns: The path that the object was moved to. Excludes the bucket name.

Examples:

@deprecated_class(start_date='Mar 2024', help='Use the ECS worker instead. Refer to the upgrade guide for more information: https://docs.prefect.io/latest/guides/upgrade-guide-agents-to-workers/.')
class ECSTask(prefect.infrastructure.base.Infrastructure): 
 218@deprecated_class(
 219    start_date="Mar 2024",
 220    help=(
 221        "Use the ECS worker instead."
 222        " Refer to the upgrade guide for more information:"
 223        " https://docs.prefect.io/latest/guides/upgrade-guide-agents-to-workers/."
 224    ),
 225)
 226class ECSTask(Infrastructure):
 227    """
 228    Run a command as an ECS task.
 229
 230    Attributes:
 231        type: The slug for this task type with a default value of "ecs-task".
 232        aws_credentials: The AWS credentials to use to connect to ECS with a
 233            default factory of AwsCredentials.
 234        task_definition_arn: An optional identifier for an existing task definition
 235            to use. If fields are set on the ECSTask that conflict with the task
 236            definition, a new copy will be registered with the required values.
 237            Cannot be used with task_definition. If not provided, Prefect will
 238            generate and register a minimal task definition.
 239        task_definition: An optional ECS task definition to use. Prefect may set
 240            defaults or override fields on this task definition to match other
 241            ECSTask fields. Cannot be used with task_definition_arn.
 242            If not provided, Prefect will generate and register
 243            a minimal task definition.
 244        family: An optional family for the task definition. If not provided,
 245            it will be inferred from the task definition. If the task definition
 246            does not have a family, the name will be generated. When flow and
 247            deployment metadata is available, the generated name will include
 248            their names. Values for this field will be slugified to match
 249            AWS character requirements.
 250        image: An optional image to use for the Prefect container in the task.
 251            If this value is not null, it will override the value in the task
 252            definition. This value defaults to a Prefect base image matching
 253            your local versions.
 254        auto_deregister_task_definition: A boolean that controls if any task
 255            definitions that are created by this block will be deregistered
 256            or not. Existing task definitions linked by ARN will never be
 257            deregistered. Deregistering a task definition does not remove
 258            it from your AWS account, instead it will be marked as INACTIVE.
 259        cpu: The amount of CPU to provide to the ECS task. Valid amounts are
 260            specified in the AWS documentation. If not provided, a default
 261            value of ECS_DEFAULT_CPU will be used unless present on
 262            the task definition.
 263        memory: The amount of memory to provide to the ECS task.
 264            Valid amounts are specified in the AWS documentation.
 265            If not provided, a default value of ECS_DEFAULT_MEMORY
 266            will be used unless present on the task definition.
 267        execution_role_arn: An execution role to use for the task.
 268            This controls the permissions of the task when it is launching.
 269            If this value is not null, it will override the value in the task
 270            definition. An execution role must be provided to capture logs
 271            from the container.
 272        configure_cloudwatch_logs: A boolean that controls if the Prefect
 273            container will be configured to send its output to the
 274            AWS CloudWatch logs service or not. This functionality requires
 275            an execution role with permissions to create log streams and groups.
 276        cloudwatch_logs_options: A dictionary of options to pass to
 277            the CloudWatch logs configuration.
 278        stream_output: A boolean indicating whether logs will be
 279            streamed from the Prefect container to the local console.
 280        launch_type: An optional launch type for the ECS task run infrastructure.
 281        vpc_id: An optional VPC ID to link the task run to.
 282            This is only applicable when using the 'awsvpc' network mode for your task.
 283        cluster: An optional ECS cluster to run the task in.
 284            The ARN or name may be provided. If not provided,
 285            the default cluster will be used.
 286        env: A dictionary of environment variables to provide to
 287            the task run. These variables are set on the
 288            Prefect container at task runtime.
 289        task_role_arn: An optional role to attach to the task run.
 290            This controls the permissions of the task while it is running.
 291        task_customizations: A list of JSON 6902 patches to apply to the task
 292            run request. If a string is given, it will parsed as a JSON expression.
 293        task_start_timeout_seconds: The amount of time to watch for the
 294            start of the ECS task before marking it as failed. The task must
 295            enter a RUNNING state to be considered started.
 296        task_watch_poll_interval: The amount of time to wait between AWS API
 297            calls while monitoring the state of an ECS task.
 298    """

 494    @root_validator(pre=True)
 495    def set_default_configure_cloudwatch_logs(cls, values: dict) -> dict:
 496        """
 497        Streaming output generally requires CloudWatch logs to be configured.
 498
 499        To avoid entangled arguments in the simple case, `configure_cloudwatch_logs`
 500        defaults to matching the value of `stream_output`.
 501        """
 502        configure_cloudwatch_logs = values.get("configure_cloudwatch_logs")
 503        if configure_cloudwatch_logs is None:
 504            values["configure_cloudwatch_logs"] = values.get("stream_output")
 505        return values
 506
 507    @root_validator
 508    def configure_cloudwatch_logs_requires_execution_role_arn(
 509        cls, values: dict
 510    ) -> dict:
 511        """
 512        Enforces that an execution role arn is provided (or could be provided by a
 513        runtime task definition) when configuring logging.
 514        """
 515        if (
 516            values.get("configure_cloudwatch_logs")
 517            and not values.get("execution_role_arn")
 518            # Do not raise if they've linked to another task definition or provided
 519            # it without using our shortcuts
 520            and not values.get("task_definition_arn")
 521            and not (values.get("task_definition") or {}).get("executionRoleArn")
 522        ):
 523            raise ValueError(
 524                "An `execution_role_arn` must be provided to use "
 525                "`configure_cloudwatch_logs` or `stream_logs`."
 526            )
 527        return values
 528
 529    @root_validator
 530    def cloudwatch_logs_options_requires_configure_cloudwatch_logs(
 531        cls, values: dict
 532    ) -> dict:
 533        """
 534        Enforces that an execution role arn is provided (or could be provided by a
 535        runtime task definition) when configuring logging.
 536        """
 537        if values.get("cloudwatch_logs_options") and not values.get(
 538            "configure_cloudwatch_logs"
 539        ):
 540            raise ValueError(
 541                "`configure_cloudwatch_log` must be enabled to use "
 542                "`cloudwatch_logs_options`."
 543            )
 544        return values
 545
 546    @root_validator(pre=True)
 547    def image_is_required(cls, values: dict) -> dict:
 548        """
 549        Enforces that an image is available if image is `None`.
 550        """
 551        has_image = bool(values.get("image"))
 552        has_task_definition_arn = bool(values.get("task_definition_arn"))
 553
 554        # The image can only be null when the task_definition_arn is set
 555        if has_image or has_task_definition_arn:
 556            return values
 557
 558        prefect_container = (
 559            get_prefect_container(
 560                (values.get("task_definition") or {}).get("containerDefinitions", [])
 561            )
 562            or {}
 563        )
 564        image_in_task_definition = prefect_container.get("image")
 565
 566        # If a task_definition is given with a prefect container image, use that value
 567        if image_in_task_definition:
 568            values["image"] = image_in_task_definition
 569        # Otherwise, it should default to the Prefect base image
 570        else:
 571            values["image"] = get_prefect_image_name()
 572        return values
 573
 574    @validator("task_customizations", pre=True)
 575    def cast_customizations_to_a_json_patch(
 576        cls, value: Union[List[Dict], JsonPatch, str]
 577    ) -> JsonPatch:
 578        """
 579        Casts lists to JsonPatch instances.
 580        """
 581        if isinstance(value, str):
 582            value = json.loads(value)
 583        if isinstance(value, list):
 584            return JsonPatch(value)
 585        return value  # type: ignore
 586
 587    class Config:
 588        """Configuration of pydantic."""
 589
 590        # Support serialization of the 'JsonPatch' type
 591        arbitrary_types_allowed = True
 592        json_encoders = {JsonPatch: lambda p: p.patch}
 593
 594    def dict(self, *args, **kwargs) -> Dict:
 595        """
 596        Convert to a dictionary.
 597        """
 598        # Support serialization of the 'JsonPatch' type
 599        d = super().dict(*args, **kwargs)
 600        d["task_customizations"] = self.task_customizations.patch
 601        return d

 603    def prepare_for_flow_run(
 604        self: Self,
 605        flow_run: "FlowRun",
 606        deployment: Optional["Deployment"] = None,
 607        flow: Optional["Flow"] = None,
 608    ) -> Self:
 609        """
 610        Return an copy of the block that is prepared to execute a flow run.
 611        """
 612        new_family = None
 613
 614        # Update the family if not specified elsewhere
 615        if (
 616            not self.family
 617            and not self.task_definition_arn
 618            and not (self.task_definition and self.task_definition.get("family"))
 619        ):
 620            if flow and deployment:
 621                new_family = f"{ECS_DEFAULT_FAMILY}__{flow.name}__{deployment.name}"
 622            elif flow and not deployment:
 623                new_family = f"{ECS_DEFAULT_FAMILY}__{flow.name}"
 624            elif deployment and not flow:
 625                # This is a weird case and should not be see in the wild
 626                new_family = f"{ECS_DEFAULT_FAMILY}__unknown-flow__{deployment.name}"
 627
 628        new = super().prepare_for_flow_run(flow_run, deployment=deployment, flow=flow)
 629
 630        if new_family:
 631            return new.copy(update={"family": new_family})
 632        else:
 633            # Avoid an extra copy if not needed
 634            return new
 635
 636    @sync_compatible
 637    async def run(self, task_status: Optional[TaskStatus] = None) -> ECSTaskResult:
 638        """
 639        Run the configured task on ECS.
 640        """
 641        boto_session, ecs_client = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 642            self._get_session_and_client
 643        )
 644
 645        (
 646            task_arn,
 647            cluster_arn,
 648            task_definition,
 649            is_new_task_definition,
 650        ) = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 651            self._create_task_and_wait_for_start, boto_session, ecs_client
 652        )
 653
 654        # Display a nice message indicating the command and image
 655        command = self.command or get_prefect_container(
 656            task_definition["containerDefinitions"]
 657        ).get("command", [])
 658        self.logger.info(
 659            f"{self._log_prefix}: Running command {' '.join(command)!r} "
 660            f"in container {PREFECT_ECS_CONTAINER_NAME!r} ({self.image})..."
 661        )
 662
 663        # The task identifier is "{cluster}::{task}" where we use the configured cluster
 664        # if set to preserve matching by name rather than arn
 665        # Note "::" is used despite the Prefect standard being ":" because ARNs contain
 666        # single colons.
 667        identifier = (self.cluster if self.cluster else cluster_arn) + "::" + task_arn
 668
 669        if task_status:
 670            task_status.started(identifier)
 671
 672        status_code = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 673            self._watch_task_and_get_exit_code,
 674            task_arn,
 675            cluster_arn,
 676            task_definition,
 677            is_new_task_definition and self.auto_deregister_task_definition,
 678            boto_session,
 679            ecs_client,
 680        )
 681
 682        return ECSTaskResult(
 683            identifier=identifier,
 684            # If the container does not start the exit code can be null but we must
 685            # still report a status code. We use a -1 to indicate a special code.
 686            status_code=status_code if status_code is not None else -1,
 687        )
 688
 689    @sync_compatible
 690    async def kill(self, identifier: str, grace_seconds: int = 30) -> None:
 691        """
 692        Kill a task running on ECS.
 693
 694        Args:
 695            identifier: A cluster and task arn combination. This should match a value
 696                yielded by `ECSTask.run`.
 697        """
 698        if grace_seconds != 30:
 699            self.logger.warning(
 700                f"Kill grace period of {grace_seconds}s requested, but AWS does not "
 701                "support dynamic grace period configuration so 30s will be used. "
 702                "See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/ecs-agent-config.html for configuration of grace periods."  # noqa
 703            )
 704        cluster, task = parse_task_identifier(identifier)
 705        await run_sync_in_worker_thread(self._stop_task, cluster, task)
 706
 707    @staticmethod
 708    def get_corresponding_worker_type() -> str:
 709        """Return the corresponding worker type for this infrastructure block."""
 710        return ECSWorker.type
 711
 712    async def generate_work_pool_base_job_template(self) -> dict:
 713        """
 714        Generate a base job template for a cloud-run work pool with the same
 715        configuration as this block.
 716
 717        Returns:
 718            - dict: a base job template for a cloud-run work pool
 719        """
 720        base_job_template = copy.deepcopy(ECSWorker.get_default_base_job_template())
 721        for key, value in self.dict(exclude_unset=True, exclude_defaults=True).items():
 722            if key == "command":
 723                base_job_template["variables"]["properties"]["command"][
 724                    "default"
 725                ] = shlex.join(value)
 726            elif key in [
 727                "type",
 728                "block_type_slug",
 729                "_block_document_id",
 730                "_block_document_name",
 731                "_is_anonymous",
 732                "task_customizations",
 733            ]:
 734                continue
 735            elif key == "aws_credentials":
 736                if not self.aws_credentials._block_document_id:
 737                    raise BlockNotSavedError(
 738                        "It looks like you are trying to use a block that"
 739                        " has not been saved. Please call `.save` on your block"
 740                        " before publishing it as a work pool."
 741                    )
 742                base_job_template["variables"]["properties"]["aws_credentials"][
 743                    "default"
 744                ] = {
 745                    "$ref": {
 746                        "block_document_id": str(
 747                            self.aws_credentials._block_document_id
 748                        )
 749                    }
 750                }
 751            elif key == "task_definition":
 752                base_job_template["job_configuration"]["task_definition"] = value
 753            elif key in base_job_template["variables"]["properties"]:
 754                base_job_template["variables"]["properties"][key]["default"] = value
 755            else:
 756                self.logger.warning(
 757                    f"Variable {key!r} is not supported by Cloud Run work pools."
 758                    " Skipping."
 759                )
 760
 761        if self.task_customizations:
 762            network_config_patches = JsonPatch(
 763                [
 764                    patch
 765                    for patch in self.task_customizations
 766                    if "networkConfiguration" in patch["path"]
 767                ]
 768            )
 769            minimal_network_config = assemble_document_for_patches(
 770                network_config_patches
 771            )
 772            if minimal_network_config:
 773                minimal_network_config_with_patches = network_config_patches.apply(
 774                    minimal_network_config
 775                )
 776                base_job_template["variables"]["properties"]["network_configuration"][
 777                    "default"
 778                ] = minimal_network_config_with_patches["networkConfiguration"]
 779            try:
 780                base_job_template["job_configuration"][
 781                    "task_run_request"
 782                ] = self.task_customizations.apply(
 783                    base_job_template["job_configuration"]["task_run_request"]
 784                )
 785            except JsonPointerException:
 786                self.logger.warning(
 787                    "Unable to apply task customizations to the base job template."
 788                    "You may need to update the template manually."
 789                )
 790
 791        return base_job_template
 792
 793    def _stop_task(self, cluster: str, task: str) -> None:
 794        """
 795        Stop a running ECS task.
 796        """
 797        if self.cluster is not None and cluster != self.cluster:
 798            raise InfrastructureNotAvailable(
 799                "Cannot stop ECS task: this infrastructure block has access to "
 800                f"cluster {self.cluster!r} but the task is running in cluster "
 801                f"{cluster!r}."
 802            )
 803
 804        _, ecs_client = self._get_session_and_client()
 805        try:
 806            ecs_client.stop_task(cluster=cluster, task=task)
 807        except Exception as exc:
 808            # Raise a special exception if the task does not exist
 809            if "ClusterNotFound" in str(exc):
 810                raise InfrastructureNotFound(
 811                    f"Cannot stop ECS task: the cluster {cluster!r} could not be found."
 812                ) from exc
 813            if "not find task" in str(exc) or "referenced task was not found" in str(
 814                exc
 815            ):
 816                raise InfrastructureNotFound(
 817                    f"Cannot stop ECS task: the task {task!r} could not be found in "
 818                    f"cluster {cluster!r}."
 819                ) from exc
 820            if "no registered tasks" in str(exc):
 821                raise InfrastructureNotFound(
 822                    f"Cannot stop ECS task: the cluster {cluster!r} has no tasks."
 823                ) from exc
 824
 825            # Reraise unknown exceptions
 826            raise
 827
 828    @property
 829    def _log_prefix(self) -> str:
 830        """
 831        Internal property for generating a prefix for logs where `name` may be null
 832        """
 833        if self.name is not None:
 834            return f"ECSTask {self.name!r}"
 835        else:
 836            return "ECSTask"
 837
 838    def _get_session_and_client(self) -> Tuple[boto3.Session, _ECSClient]:
 839        """
 840        Retrieve a boto3 session and ECS client
 841        """
 842        boto_session = self.aws_credentials.get_boto3_session()
 843        ecs_client = boto_session.client("ecs")
 844        return boto_session, ecs_client
 845
 846    def _create_task_and_wait_for_start(
 847        self, boto_session: boto3.Session, ecs_client: _ECSClient
 848    ) -> Tuple[str, str, dict, bool]:
 849        """
 850        Register the task definition, create the task run, and wait for it to start.
 851
 852        Returns a tuple of
 853        - The task ARN
 854        - The task's cluster ARN
 855        - The task definition
 856        - A bool indicating if the task definition is newly registered
 857        """
 858        new_task_definition_registered = False
 859        requested_task_definition = (
 860            self._retrieve_task_definition(ecs_client, self.task_definition_arn)
 861            if self.task_definition_arn
 862            else self.task_definition
 863        ) or {}
 864        task_definition_arn = requested_task_definition.get("taskDefinitionArn", None)
 865
 866        task_definition = self._prepare_task_definition(
 867            requested_task_definition, region=ecs_client.meta.region_name
 868        )
 869
 870        # We must register the task definition if the arn is null or changes were made
 871        if task_definition != requested_task_definition or not task_definition_arn:
 872            # Before registering, check if the latest task definition in the family
 873            # can be used
 874            latest_task_definition = self._retrieve_latest_task_definition(
 875                ecs_client, task_definition["family"]
 876            )
 877            if self._task_definitions_equal(latest_task_definition, task_definition):
 878                self.logger.debug(
 879                    f"{self._log_prefix}: The latest task definition matches the "
 880                    "required task definition; using that instead of registering a new "
 881                    " one."
 882                )
 883                task_definition_arn = latest_task_definition["taskDefinitionArn"]
 884            else:
 885                if task_definition_arn:
 886                    self.logger.warning(
 887                        f"{self._log_prefix}: Settings require changes to the linked "
 888                        "task definition. A new task definition will be registered. "
 889                        + (
 890                            "Enable DEBUG level logs to see the difference."
 891                            if self.logger.level > logging.DEBUG
 892                            else ""
 893                        )
 894                    )
 895                    self.logger.debug(
 896                        f"{self._log_prefix}: Diff for requested task definition"
 897                        + _pretty_diff(requested_task_definition, task_definition)
 898                    )
 899                else:
 900                    self.logger.info(
 901                        f"{self._log_prefix}: Registering task definition..."
 902                    )
 903                    self.logger.debug(
 904                        "Task definition payload\n" + yaml.dump(task_definition)
 905                    )
 906
 907                task_definition_arn = self._register_task_definition(
 908                    ecs_client, task_definition
 909                )
 910                new_task_definition_registered = True
 911
 912        if task_definition.get("networkMode") == "awsvpc":
 913            network_config = self._load_vpc_network_config(self.vpc_id, boto_session)
 914        else:
 915            network_config = None
 916
 917        task_run = self._prepare_task_run(
 918            network_config=network_config,
 919            task_definition_arn=task_definition_arn,
 920        )
 921        self.logger.info(f"{self._log_prefix}: Creating task run...")
 922        self.logger.debug("Task run payload\n" + yaml.dump(task_run))
 923
 924        try:
 925            task = self._run_task(ecs_client, task_run)
 926            task_arn = task["taskArn"]
 927            cluster_arn = task["clusterArn"]
 928        except Exception as exc:
 929            self._report_task_run_creation_failure(task_run, exc)
 930
 931        # Raises an exception if the task does not start
 932        self.logger.info(f"{self._log_prefix}: Waiting for task run to start...")
 933        self._wait_for_task_start(
 934            task_arn, cluster_arn, ecs_client, timeout=self.task_start_timeout_seconds
 935        )
 936
 937        return task_arn, cluster_arn, task_definition, new_task_definition_registered
 938
 939    def _watch_task_and_get_exit_code(
 940        self,
 941        task_arn: str,
 942        cluster_arn: str,
 943        task_definition: dict,
 944        deregister_task_definition: bool,
 945        boto_session: boto3.Session,
 946        ecs_client: _ECSClient,
 947    ) -> Optional[int]:
 948        """
 949        Wait for the task run to complete and retrieve the exit code of the Prefect
 950        container.
 951        """
 952
 953        # Wait for completion and stream logs
 954        task = self._wait_for_task_finish(
 955            task_arn, cluster_arn, task_definition, ecs_client, boto_session
 956        )
 957
 958        if deregister_task_definition:
 959            ecs_client.deregister_task_definition(
 960                taskDefinition=task["taskDefinitionArn"]
 961            )
 962
 963        # Check the status code of the Prefect container
 964        prefect_container = get_prefect_container(task["containers"])
 965        assert (
 966            prefect_container is not None
 967        ), f"'prefect' container missing from task: {task}"
 968        status_code = prefect_container.get("exitCode")
 969        self._report_container_status_code(PREFECT_ECS_CONTAINER_NAME, status_code)
 970
 971        return status_code
 972
 973    def _task_definitions_equal(self, taskdef_1, taskdef_2) -> bool:
 974        """
 975        Compare two task definitions.
 976
 977        Since one may come from the AWS API and have populated defaults, we do our best
 978        to homogenize the definitions without changing their meaning.
 979        """
 980        if taskdef_1 == taskdef_2:
 981            return True
 982
 983        if taskdef_1 is None or taskdef_2 is None:
 984            return False
 985
 986        taskdef_1 = copy.deepcopy(taskdef_1)
 987        taskdef_2 = copy.deepcopy(taskdef_2)
 988
 989        def _set_aws_defaults(taskdef):
 990            """Set defaults that AWS would set after registration"""
 991            container_definitions = taskdef.get("containerDefinitions", [])
 992            essential = any(
 993                container.get("essential") for container in container_definitions
 994            )
 995            if not essential:
 996                container_definitions[0].setdefault("essential", True)
 997
 998            taskdef.setdefault("networkMode", "bridge")
 999
1000        _set_aws_defaults(taskdef_1)
1001        _set_aws_defaults(taskdef_2)
1002
1003        def _drop_empty_keys(dict_):
1004            """Recursively drop keys with 'empty' values"""
1005            for key, value in tuple(dict_.items()):
1006                if not value:
1007                    dict_.pop(key)
1008                if isinstance(value, dict):
1009                    _drop_empty_keys(value)
1010                if isinstance(value, list):
1011                    for v in value:
1012                        if isinstance(v, dict):
1013                            _drop_empty_keys(v)
1014
1015        _drop_empty_keys(taskdef_1)
1016        _drop_empty_keys(taskdef_2)
1017
1018        # Clear fields that change on registration for comparison
1019        for field in POST_REGISTRATION_FIELDS:
1020            taskdef_1.pop(field, None)
1021            taskdef_2.pop(field, None)
1022
1023        return taskdef_1 == taskdef_2
1024
1025    def preview(self) -> str:
1026        """
1027        Generate a preview of the task definition and task run that will be sent to AWS.
1028        """
1029        preview = ""
1030
1031        task_definition_arn = self.task_definition_arn or "<registered at runtime>"
1032
1033        if self.task_definition or not self.task_definition_arn:
1034            task_definition = self._prepare_task_definition(
1035                self.task_definition or {},
1036                region=self.aws_credentials.region_name
1037                or "<loaded from client at runtime>",
1038            )
1039            preview += "---\n# Task definition\n"
1040            preview += yaml.dump(task_definition)
1041            preview += "\n"
1042        else:
1043            task_definition = None
1044
1045        if task_definition and task_definition.get("networkMode") == "awsvpc":
1046            vpc = "the default VPC" if not self.vpc_id else self.vpc_id
1047            network_config = {
1048                "awsvpcConfiguration": {
1049                    "subnets": f"<loaded from {vpc} at runtime>",
1050                    "assignPublicIp": "ENABLED",
1051                }
1052            }
1053        else:
1054            network_config = None
1055
1056        task_run = self._prepare_task_run(network_config, task_definition_arn)
1057        preview += "---\n# Task run request\n"
1058        preview += yaml.dump(task_run)
1059
1060        return preview
1061
1062    def _report_container_status_code(
1063        self, name: str, status_code: Optional[int]
1064    ) -> None:
1065        """
1066        Display a log for the given container status code.
1067        """
1068        if status_code is None:
1069            self.logger.error(
1070                f"{self._log_prefix}: Task exited without reporting an exit status "
1071                f"for container {name!r}."
1072            )
1073        elif status_code == 0:
1074            self.logger.info(
1075                f"{self._log_prefix}: Container {name!r} exited successfully."
1076            )
1077        else:
1078            self.logger.warning(
1079                f"{self._log_prefix}: Container {name!r} exited with non-zero exit "
1080                f"code {status_code}."
1081            )
1082
1083    def _report_task_run_creation_failure(self, task_run: dict, exc: Exception) -> None:
1084        """
1085        Wrap common AWS task run creation failures with nicer user-facing messages.
1086        """
1087        # AWS generates exception types at runtime so they must be captured a bit
1088        # differently than normal.
1089        if "ClusterNotFoundException" in str(exc):
1090            cluster = task_run.get("cluster", "default")
1091            raise RuntimeError(
1092                f"Failed to run ECS task, cluster {cluster!r} not found. "
1093                "Confirm that the cluster is configured in your region."
1094            ) from exc
1095        elif "No Container Instances" in str(exc) and self.launch_type == "EC2":
1096            cluster = task_run.get("cluster", "default")
1097            raise RuntimeError(
1098                f"Failed to run ECS task, cluster {cluster!r} does not appear to "
1099                "have any container instances associated with it. Confirm that you "
1100                "have EC2 container instances available."
1101            ) from exc
1102        elif (
1103            "failed to validate logger args" in str(exc)
1104            and "AccessDeniedException" in str(exc)
1105            and self.configure_cloudwatch_logs
1106        ):
1107            raise RuntimeError(
1108                "Failed to run ECS task, the attached execution role does not appear "
1109                "to have sufficient permissions. Ensure that the execution role "
1110                f"{self.execution_role!r} has permissions logs:CreateLogStream, "
1111                "logs:CreateLogGroup, and logs:PutLogEvents."
1112            )
1113        else:
1114            raise
1115
1116    def _watch_task_run(
1117        self,
1118        task_arn: str,
1119        cluster_arn: str,
1120        ecs_client: _ECSClient,
1121        current_status: str = "UNKNOWN",
1122        until_status: str = None,
1123        timeout: int = None,
1124    ) -> Generator[None, None, dict]:
1125        """
1126        Watches an ECS task run by querying every `poll_interval` seconds. After each
1127        query, the retrieved task is yielded. This function returns when the task run
1128        reaches a STOPPED status or the provided `until_status`.
1129
1130        Emits a log each time the status changes.
1131        """
1132        last_status = status = current_status
1133        t0 = time.time()
1134        while status != until_status:
1135            tasks = ecs_client.describe_tasks(
1136                tasks=[task_arn], cluster=cluster_arn, include=["TAGS"]
1137            )["tasks"]
1138
1139            if tasks:
1140                task = tasks[0]
1141
1142                status = task["lastStatus"]
1143                if status != last_status:
1144                    self.logger.info(f"{self._log_prefix}: Status is {status}.")
1145
1146                yield task
1147
1148                # No point in continuing if the status is final
1149                if status == "STOPPED":
1150                    break
1151
1152                last_status = status
1153
1154            else:
1155                # Intermittently, the task will not be described. We wat to respect the
1156                # watch timeout though.
1157                self.logger.debug(f"{self._log_prefix}: Task not found.")
1158
1159            elapsed_time = time.time() - t0
1160            if timeout is not None and elapsed_time > timeout:
1161                raise RuntimeError(
1162                    f"Timed out after {elapsed_time}s while watching task for status "
1163                    f"{until_status or 'STOPPED'}"
1164                )
1165            time.sleep(self.task_watch_poll_interval)
1166
1167    def _wait_for_task_start(
1168        self, task_arn: str, cluster_arn: str, ecs_client: _ECSClient, timeout: int
1169    ) -> dict:
1170        """
1171        Waits for an ECS task run to reach a RUNNING status.
1172
1173        If a STOPPED status is reached instead, an exception is raised indicating the
1174        reason that the task run did not start.
1175        """
1176        for task in self._watch_task_run(
1177            task_arn, cluster_arn, ecs_client, until_status="RUNNING", timeout=timeout
1178        ):
1179            # TODO: It is possible that the task has passed _through_ a RUNNING
1180            #       status during the polling interval. In this case, there is not an
1181            #       exception to raise.
1182            if task["lastStatus"] == "STOPPED":
1183                code = task.get("stopCode")
1184                reason = task.get("stoppedReason")
1185                # Generate a dynamic exception type from the AWS name
1186                raise type(code, (RuntimeError,), {})(reason)
1187
1188        return task
1189
1190    def _wait_for_task_finish(
1191        self,
1192        task_arn: str,
1193        cluster_arn: str,
1194        task_definition: dict,
1195        ecs_client: _ECSClient,
1196        boto_session: boto3.Session,
1197    ):
1198        """
1199        Watch an ECS task until it reaches a STOPPED status.
1200
1201        If configured, logs from the Prefect container are streamed to stderr.
1202
1203        Returns a description of the task on completion.
1204        """
1205        can_stream_output = False
1206
1207        if self.stream_output:
1208            container_def = get_prefect_container(
1209                task_definition["containerDefinitions"]
1210            )
1211            if not container_def:
1212                self.logger.warning(
1213                    f"{self._log_prefix}: Prefect container definition not found in "
1214                    "task definition. Output cannot be streamed."
1215                )
1216            elif not container_def.get("logConfiguration"):
1217                self.logger.warning(
1218                    f"{self._log_prefix}: Logging configuration not found on task. "
1219                    "Output cannot be streamed."
1220                )
1221            elif not container_def["logConfiguration"].get("logDriver") == "awslogs":
1222                self.logger.warning(
1223                    f"{self._log_prefix}: Logging configuration uses unsupported "
1224                    " driver {container_def['logConfiguration'].get('logDriver')!r}. "
1225                    "Output cannot be streamed."
1226                )
1227            else:
1228                # Prepare to stream the output
1229                log_config = container_def["logConfiguration"]["options"]
1230                logs_client = boto_session.client("logs")
1231                can_stream_output = True
1232                # Track the last log timestamp to prevent double display
1233                last_log_timestamp: Optional[int] = None
1234                # Determine the name of the stream as "prefix/container/run-id"
1235                stream_name = "/".join(
1236                    [
1237                        log_config["awslogs-stream-prefix"],
1238                        PREFECT_ECS_CONTAINER_NAME,
1239                        task_arn.rsplit("/")[-1],
1240                    ]
1241                )
1242                self.logger.info(
1243                    f"{self._log_prefix}: Streaming output from container "
1244                    f"{PREFECT_ECS_CONTAINER_NAME!r}..."
1245                )
1246
1247        for task in self._watch_task_run(
1248            task_arn, cluster_arn, ecs_client, current_status="RUNNING"
1249        ):
1250            if self.stream_output and can_stream_output:
1251                # On each poll for task run status, also retrieve available logs
1252                last_log_timestamp = self._stream_available_logs(
1253                    logs_client,
1254                    log_group=log_config["awslogs-group"],
1255                    log_stream=stream_name,
1256                    last_log_timestamp=last_log_timestamp,
1257                )
1258
1259        return task
1260
1261    def _stream_available_logs(
1262        self,
1263        logs_client: Any,
1264        log_group: str,
1265        log_stream: str,
1266        last_log_timestamp: Optional[int] = None,
1267    ) -> Optional[int]:
1268        """
1269        Stream logs from the given log group and stream since the last log timestamp.
1270
1271        Will continue on paginated responses until all logs are returned.
1272
1273        Returns the last log timestamp which can be used to call this method in the
1274        future.
1275        """
1276        last_log_stream_token = "NO-TOKEN"
1277        next_log_stream_token = None
1278
1279        # AWS will return the same token that we send once the end of the paginated
1280        # response is reached
1281        while last_log_stream_token != next_log_stream_token:
1282            last_log_stream_token = next_log_stream_token
1283
1284            request = {
1285                "logGroupName": log_group,
1286                "logStreamName": log_stream,
1287            }
1288
1289            if last_log_stream_token is not None:
1290                request["nextToken"] = last_log_stream_token
1291
1292            if last_log_timestamp is not None:
1293                # Bump the timestamp by one ms to avoid retrieving the last log again
1294                request["startTime"] = last_log_timestamp + 1
1295
1296            try:
1297                response = logs_client.get_log_events(**request)
1298            except Exception:
1299                self.logger.error(
1300                    (
1301                        f"{self._log_prefix}: Failed to read log events with request "
1302                        f"{request}"
1303                    ),
1304                    exc_info=True,
1305                )
1306                return last_log_timestamp
1307
1308            log_events = response["events"]
1309            for log_event in log_events:
1310                # TODO: This doesn't forward to the local logger, which can be
1311                #       bad for customizing handling and understanding where the
1312                #       log is coming from, but it avoid nesting logger information
1313                #       when the content is output from a Prefect logger on the
1314                #       running infrastructure
1315                print(log_event["message"], file=sys.stderr)
1316
1317                if (
1318                    last_log_timestamp is None
1319                    or log_event["timestamp"] > last_log_timestamp
1320                ):
1321                    last_log_timestamp = log_event["timestamp"]
1322
1323            next_log_stream_token = response.get("nextForwardToken")
1324            if not log_events:
1325                # Stop reading pages if there was no data
1326                break
1327
1328        return last_log_timestamp
1329
1330    def _retrieve_latest_task_definition(
1331        self, ecs_client: _ECSClient, task_definition_family: str
1332    ) -> Optional[dict]:
1333        try:
1334            latest_task_definition = self._retrieve_task_definition(
1335                ecs_client, task_definition_family
1336            )
1337        except Exception:
1338            # The family does not exist...
1339            return None
1340
1341        return latest_task_definition
1342
1343    def _retrieve_task_definition(
1344        self, ecs_client: _ECSClient, task_definition_arn: str
1345    ):
1346        """
1347        Retrieve an existing task definition from AWS.
1348        """
1349        self.logger.info(
1350            f"{self._log_prefix}: Retrieving task definition {task_definition_arn!r}..."
1351        )
1352        response = ecs_client.describe_task_definition(
1353            taskDefinition=task_definition_arn
1354        )
1355        return response["taskDefinition"]
1356
1357    def _register_task_definition(
1358        self, ecs_client: _ECSClient, task_definition: dict
1359    ) -> str:
1360        """
1361        Register a new task definition with AWS.
1362        """
1363        # TODO: Consider including a global cache for this task definition since
1364        #       registration of task definitions is frequently rate limited
1365        task_definition_request = copy.deepcopy(task_definition)
1366
1367        # We need to remove some fields here if copying an existing task definition
1368        for field in POST_REGISTRATION_FIELDS:
1369            task_definition_request.pop(field, None)
1370
1371        response = ecs_client.register_task_definition(**task_definition_request)
1372        return response["taskDefinition"]["taskDefinitionArn"]
1373
1374    def _prepare_task_definition(self, task_definition: dict, region: str) -> dict:
1375        """
1376        Prepare a task definition by inferring any defaults and merging overrides.
1377        """
1378        task_definition = copy.deepcopy(task_definition)
1379
1380        # Configure the Prefect runtime container
1381        task_definition.setdefault("containerDefinitions", [])
1382        container = get_prefect_container(task_definition["containerDefinitions"])
1383        if container is None:
1384            container = {"name": PREFECT_ECS_CONTAINER_NAME}
1385            task_definition["containerDefinitions"].append(container)
1386
1387        if self.image:
1388            container["image"] = self.image
1389
1390        # Remove any keys that have been explicitly "unset"
1391        unset_keys = {key for key, value in self.env.items() if value is None}
1392        for item in tuple(container.get("environment", [])):
1393            if item["name"] in unset_keys:
1394                container["environment"].remove(item)
1395
1396        if self.configure_cloudwatch_logs:
1397            container["logConfiguration"] = {
1398                "logDriver": "awslogs",
1399                "options": {
1400                    "awslogs-create-group": "true",
1401                    "awslogs-group": "prefect",
1402                    "awslogs-region": region,
1403                    "awslogs-stream-prefix": self.name or "prefect",
1404                    **self.cloudwatch_logs_options,
1405                },
1406            }
1407
1408        family = self.family or task_definition.get("family") or ECS_DEFAULT_FAMILY
1409        task_definition["family"] = slugify(
1410            family,
1411            max_length=255,
1412            regex_pattern=r"[^a-zA-Z0-9-_]+",
1413        )
1414
1415        # CPU and memory are required in some cases, retrieve the value to use
1416        cpu = self.cpu or task_definition.get("cpu") or ECS_DEFAULT_CPU
1417        memory = self.memory or task_definition.get("memory") or ECS_DEFAULT_MEMORY
1418
1419        if self.launch_type == "FARGATE" or self.launch_type == "FARGATE_SPOT":
1420            # Task level memory and cpu are required when using fargate
1421            task_definition["cpu"] = str(cpu)
1422            task_definition["memory"] = str(memory)
1423
1424            # The FARGATE compatibility is required if it will be used as as launch type
1425            requires_compatibilities = task_definition.setdefault(
1426                "requiresCompatibilities", []
1427            )
1428            if "FARGATE" not in requires_compatibilities:
1429                task_definition["requiresCompatibilities"].append("FARGATE")
1430
1431            # Only the 'awsvpc' network mode is supported when using FARGATE
1432            # However, we will not enforce that here if the user has set it
1433            network_mode = task_definition.setdefault("networkMode", "awsvpc")
1434
1435            if network_mode != "awsvpc":
1436                warnings.warn(
1437                    f"Found network mode {network_mode!r} which is not compatible with "
1438                    f"launch type {self.launch_type!r}. Use either the 'EC2' launch "
1439                    "type or the 'awsvpc' network mode."
1440                )
1441
1442        elif self.launch_type == "EC2":
1443            # Container level memory and cpu are required when using ec2
1444            container.setdefault("cpu", int(cpu))
1445            container.setdefault("memory", int(memory))
1446
1447        if self.execution_role_arn and not self.task_definition_arn:
1448            task_definition["executionRoleArn"] = self.execution_role_arn
1449
1450        if self.configure_cloudwatch_logs and not task_definition.get(
1451            "executionRoleArn"
1452        ):
1453            raise ValueError(
1454                "An execution role arn must be set on the task definition to use "
1455                "`configure_cloudwatch_logs` or `stream_logs` but no execution role "
1456                "was found on the task definition."
1457            )
1458
1459        return task_definition
1460
1461    def _prepare_task_run_overrides(self) -> dict:
1462        """
1463        Prepare the 'overrides' payload for a task run request.
1464        """
1465        overrides = {
1466            "containerOverrides": [
1467                {
1468                    "name": PREFECT_ECS_CONTAINER_NAME,
1469                    "environment": [
1470                        {"name": key, "value": value}
1471                        for key, value in {
1472                            **self._base_environment(),
1473                            **self.env,
1474                        }.items()
1475                        if value is not None
1476                    ],
1477                }
1478            ],
1479        }
1480
1481        prefect_container_overrides = overrides["containerOverrides"][0]
1482
1483        if self.command:
1484            prefect_container_overrides["command"] = self.command
1485
1486        if self.execution_role_arn:
1487            overrides["executionRoleArn"] = self.execution_role_arn
1488
1489        if self.task_role_arn:
1490            overrides["taskRoleArn"] = self.task_role_arn
1491
1492        if self.memory:
1493            overrides["memory"] = str(self.memory)
1494            prefect_container_overrides.setdefault("memory", self.memory)
1495
1496        if self.cpu:
1497            overrides["cpu"] = str(self.cpu)
1498            prefect_container_overrides.setdefault("cpu", self.cpu)
1499
1500        return overrides
1501
1502    def _load_vpc_network_config(
1503        self, vpc_id: Optional[str], boto_session: boto3.Session
1504    ) -> dict:
1505        """
1506        Load settings from a specific VPC or the default VPC and generate a task
1507        run request's network configuration.
1508        """
1509        ec2_client = boto_session.client("ec2")
1510        vpc_message = "the default VPC" if not vpc_id else f"VPC with ID {vpc_id}"
1511
1512        if not vpc_id:
1513            # Retrieve the default VPC
1514            describe = {"Filters": [{"Name": "isDefault", "Values": ["true"]}]}
1515        else:
1516            describe = {"VpcIds": [vpc_id]}
1517
1518        vpcs = ec2_client.describe_vpcs(**describe)["Vpcs"]
1519        if not vpcs:
1520            help_message = (
1521                "Pass an explicit `vpc_id` or configure a default VPC."
1522                if not vpc_id
1523                else "Check that the VPC exists in the current region."
1524            )
1525            raise ValueError(
1526                f"Failed to find {vpc_message}. "
1527                "Network configuration cannot be inferred. " + help_message
1528            )
1529
1530        vpc_id = vpcs[0]["VpcId"]
1531        subnets = ec2_client.describe_subnets(
1532            Filters=[{"Name": "vpc-id", "Values": [vpc_id]}]
1533        )["Subnets"]
1534        if not subnets:
1535            raise ValueError(
1536                f"Failed to find subnets for {vpc_message}. "
1537                "Network configuration cannot be inferred."
1538            )
1539
1540        return {
1541            "awsvpcConfiguration": {
1542                "subnets": [s["SubnetId"] for s in subnets],
1543                "assignPublicIp": "ENABLED",
1544                "securityGroups": [],
1545            }
1546        }
1547
1548    def _prepare_task_run(
1549        self,
1550        network_config: Optional[dict],
1551        task_definition_arn: str,
1552    ) -> dict:
1553        """
1554        Prepare a task run request payload.
1555        """
1556        task_run = {
1557            "overrides": self._prepare_task_run_overrides(),
1558            "tags": [
1559                {
1560                    "key": slugify(
1561                        key,
1562                        regex_pattern=_TAG_REGEX,
1563                        allow_unicode=True,
1564                        lowercase=False,
1565                    ),
1566                    "value": slugify(
1567                        value,
1568                        regex_pattern=_TAG_REGEX,
1569                        allow_unicode=True,
1570                        lowercase=False,
1571                    ),
1572                }
1573                for key, value in self.labels.items()
1574            ],
1575            "taskDefinition": task_definition_arn,
1576        }
1577
1578        if self.cluster:
1579            task_run["cluster"] = self.cluster
1580
1581        if self.launch_type:
1582            if self.launch_type == "FARGATE_SPOT":
1583                task_run["capacityProviderStrategy"] = [
1584                    {"capacityProvider": "FARGATE_SPOT", "weight": 1}
1585                ]
1586            else:
1587                task_run["launchType"] = self.launch_type
1588
1589        if network_config:
1590            task_run["networkConfiguration"] = network_config
1591
1592        task_run = self.task_customizations.apply(task_run)
1593        return task_run
1594
1595    def _run_task(self, ecs_client: _ECSClient, task_run: dict):
1596        """
1597        Run the task using the ECS client.
1598
1599        This is isolated as a separate method for testing purposes.
1600        """
1601        return ecs_client.run_task(**task_run)["tasks"][0]

Run a command as an ECS task.

Attributes: type: The slug for this task type with a default value of "ecs-task". aws_credentials: The AWS credentials to use to connect to ECS with a default factory of AwsCredentials. task_definition_arn: An optional identifier for an existing task definition to use. If fields are set on the ECSTask that conflict with the task definition, a new copy will be registered with the required values. Cannot be used with task_definition. If not provided, Prefect will generate and register a minimal task definition. task_definition: An optional ECS task definition to use. Prefect may set defaults or override fields on this task definition to match other ECSTask fields. Cannot be used with task_definition_arn. If not provided, Prefect will generate and register a minimal task definition. family: An optional family for the task definition. If not provided, it will be inferred from the task definition. If the task definition does not have a family, the name will be generated. When flow and deployment metadata is available, the generated name will include their names. Values for this field will be slugified to match AWS character requirements. image: An optional image to use for the Prefect container in the task. If this value is not null, it will override the value in the task definition. This value defaults to a Prefect base image matching your local versions. auto_deregister_task_definition: A boolean that controls if any task definitions that are created by this block will be deregistered or not. Existing task definitions linked by ARN will never be deregistered. Deregistering a task definition does not remove it from your AWS account, instead it will be marked as INACTIVE. cpu: The amount of CPU to provide to the ECS task. Valid amounts are specified in the AWS documentation. If not provided, a default value of ECS_DEFAULT_CPU will be used unless present on the task definition. memory: The amount of memory to provide to the ECS task. Valid amounts are specified in the AWS documentation. If not provided, a default value of ECS_DEFAULT_MEMORY will be used unless present on the task definition. execution_role_arn: An execution role to use for the task. This controls the permissions of the task when it is launching. If this value is not null, it will override the value in the task definition. An execution role must be provided to capture logs from the container. configure_cloudwatch_logs: A boolean that controls if the Prefect container will be configured to send its output to the AWS CloudWatch logs service or not. This functionality requires an execution role with permissions to create log streams and groups. cloudwatch_logs_options: A dictionary of options to pass to the CloudWatch logs configuration. stream_output: A boolean indicating whether logs will be streamed from the Prefect container to the local console. launch_type: An optional launch type for the ECS task run infrastructure. vpc_id: An optional VPC ID to link the task run to. This is only applicable when using the 'awsvpc' network mode for your task. cluster: An optional ECS cluster to run the task in. The ARN or name may be provided. If not provided, the default cluster will be used. env: A dictionary of environment variables to provide to the task run. These variables are set on the Prefect container at task runtime. task_role_arn: An optional role to attach to the task run. This controls the permissions of the task while it is running. task_customizations: A list of JSON 6902 patches to apply to the task run request. If a string is given, it will parsed as a JSON expression. task_start_timeout_seconds: The amount of time to watch for the start of the ECS task before marking it as failed. The task must enter a RUNNING state to be considered started. task_watch_poll_interval: The amount of time to wait between AWS API calls while monitoring the state of an ECS task.

1046    def __new__(cls: Type[Self], **kwargs) -> Self:
1047        """
1048        Create an instance of the Block subclass type if a `block_type_slug` is
1049        present in the data payload.
1050        """
1051        block_type_slug = kwargs.pop("block_type_slug", None)
1052        if block_type_slug:
1053            subcls = lookup_type(cls, dispatch_key=block_type_slug)
1054            m = super().__new__(subcls)
1055            # NOTE: This is a workaround for an obscure issue where copied models were
1056            #       missing attributes. This pattern is from Pydantic's
1057            #       `BaseModel._copy_and_set_values`.
1058            #       The issue this fixes could not be reproduced in unit tests that
1059            #       directly targeted dispatch handling and was only observed when
1060            #       copying then saving infrastructure blocks on deployment models.
1061            object.__setattr__(m, "__dict__", kwargs)
1062            object.__setattr__(m, "__fields_set__", set(kwargs.keys()))
1063            return m
1064        else:
1065            m = super().__new__(cls)
1066            object.__setattr__(m, "__dict__", kwargs)
1067            object.__setattr__(m, "__fields_set__", set(kwargs.keys()))
1068            return m

@root_validator(pre=True)
def image_is_required(cls, values: dict) -> dict: 
546    @root_validator(pre=True)
547    def image_is_required(cls, values: dict) -> dict:
548        """
549        Enforces that an image is available if image is `None`.
550        """
551        has_image = bool(values.get("image"))
552        has_task_definition_arn = bool(values.get("task_definition_arn"))
553
554        # The image can only be null when the task_definition_arn is set
555        if has_image or has_task_definition_arn:
556            return values
557
558        prefect_container = (
559            get_prefect_container(
560                (values.get("task_definition") or {}).get("containerDefinitions", [])
561            )
562            or {}
563        )
564        image_in_task_definition = prefect_container.get("image")
565
566        # If a task_definition is given with a prefect container image, use that value
567        if image_in_task_definition:
568            values["image"] = image_in_task_definition
569        # Otherwise, it should default to the Prefect base image
570        else:
571            values["image"] = get_prefect_image_name()
572        return values

def prepare_for_flow_run( self: Self, flow_run: prefect.client.schemas.objects.FlowRun, deployment: Optional[prefect.server.schemas.core.Deployment] = None, flow: Optional[prefect.server.schemas.core.Flow] = None) -> Self: 
603    def prepare_for_flow_run(
604        self: Self,
605        flow_run: "FlowRun",
606        deployment: Optional["Deployment"] = None,
607        flow: Optional["Flow"] = None,
608    ) -> Self:
609        """
610        Return an copy of the block that is prepared to execute a flow run.
611        """
612        new_family = None
613
614        # Update the family if not specified elsewhere
615        if (
616            not self.family
617            and not self.task_definition_arn
618            and not (self.task_definition and self.task_definition.get("family"))
619        ):
620            if flow and deployment:
621                new_family = f"{ECS_DEFAULT_FAMILY}__{flow.name}__{deployment.name}"
622            elif flow and not deployment:
623                new_family = f"{ECS_DEFAULT_FAMILY}__{flow.name}"
624            elif deployment and not flow:
625                # This is a weird case and should not be see in the wild
626                new_family = f"{ECS_DEFAULT_FAMILY}__unknown-flow__{deployment.name}"
627
628        new = super().prepare_for_flow_run(flow_run, deployment=deployment, flow=flow)
629
630        if new_family:
631            return new.copy(update={"family": new_family})
632        else:
633            # Avoid an extra copy if not needed
634            return new

Return an copy of the block that is prepared to execute a flow run.

@sync_compatible
async def run( self, task_status: Optional[anyio.abc.TaskStatus] = None) -> prefect_aws.ecs.ECSTaskResult: 
636    @sync_compatible
637    async def run(self, task_status: Optional[TaskStatus] = None) -> ECSTaskResult:
638        """
639        Run the configured task on ECS.
640        """
641        boto_session, ecs_client = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
642            self._get_session_and_client
643        )
644
645        (
646            task_arn,
647            cluster_arn,
648            task_definition,
649            is_new_task_definition,
650        ) = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
651            self._create_task_and_wait_for_start, boto_session, ecs_client
652        )
653
654        # Display a nice message indicating the command and image
655        command = self.command or get_prefect_container(
656            task_definition["containerDefinitions"]
657        ).get("command", [])
658        self.logger.info(
659            f"{self._log_prefix}: Running command {' '.join(command)!r} "
660            f"in container {PREFECT_ECS_CONTAINER_NAME!r} ({self.image})..."
661        )
662
663        # The task identifier is "{cluster}::{task}" where we use the configured cluster
664        # if set to preserve matching by name rather than arn
665        # Note "::" is used despite the Prefect standard being ":" because ARNs contain
666        # single colons.
667        identifier = (self.cluster if self.cluster else cluster_arn) + "::" + task_arn
668
669        if task_status:
670            task_status.started(identifier)
671
672        status_code = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
673            self._watch_task_and_get_exit_code,
674            task_arn,
675            cluster_arn,
676            task_definition,
677            is_new_task_definition and self.auto_deregister_task_definition,
678            boto_session,
679            ecs_client,
680        )
681
682        return ECSTaskResult(
683            identifier=identifier,
684            # If the container does not start the exit code can be null but we must
685            # still report a status code. We use a -1 to indicate a special code.
686            status_code=status_code if status_code is not None else -1,
687        )

Run the configured task on ECS.

@sync_compatible
async def kill(self, identifier: str, grace_seconds: int = 30) -> None: 
689    @sync_compatible
690    async def kill(self, identifier: str, grace_seconds: int = 30) -> None:
691        """
692        Kill a task running on ECS.
693
694        Args:
695            identifier: A cluster and task arn combination. This should match a value
696                yielded by `ECSTask.run`.
697        """
698        if grace_seconds != 30:
699            self.logger.warning(
700                f"Kill grace period of {grace_seconds}s requested, but AWS does not "
701                "support dynamic grace period configuration so 30s will be used. "
702                "See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/ecs-agent-config.html for configuration of grace periods."  # noqa
703            )
704        cluster, task = parse_task_identifier(identifier)
705        await run_sync_in_worker_thread(self._stop_task, cluster, task)

async def generate_work_pool_base_job_template(self) -> <function ECSTask.dict at 0x10a13a660>: 
712    async def generate_work_pool_base_job_template(self) -> dict:
713        """
714        Generate a base job template for a cloud-run work pool with the same
715        configuration as this block.
716
717        Returns:
718            - dict: a base job template for a cloud-run work pool
719        """
720        base_job_template = copy.deepcopy(ECSWorker.get_default_base_job_template())
721        for key, value in self.dict(exclude_unset=True, exclude_defaults=True).items():
722            if key == "command":
723                base_job_template["variables"]["properties"]["command"][
724                    "default"
725                ] = shlex.join(value)
726            elif key in [
727                "type",
728                "block_type_slug",
729                "_block_document_id",
730                "_block_document_name",
731                "_is_anonymous",
732                "task_customizations",
733            ]:
734                continue
735            elif key == "aws_credentials":
736                if not self.aws_credentials._block_document_id:
737                    raise BlockNotSavedError(
738                        "It looks like you are trying to use a block that"
739                        " has not been saved. Please call `.save` on your block"
740                        " before publishing it as a work pool."
741                    )
742                base_job_template["variables"]["properties"]["aws_credentials"][
743                    "default"
744                ] = {
745                    "$ref": {
746                        "block_document_id": str(
747                            self.aws_credentials._block_document_id
748                        )
749                    }
750                }
751            elif key == "task_definition":
752                base_job_template["job_configuration"]["task_definition"] = value
753            elif key in base_job_template["variables"]["properties"]:
754                base_job_template["variables"]["properties"][key]["default"] = value
755            else:
756                self.logger.warning(
757                    f"Variable {key!r} is not supported by Cloud Run work pools."
758                    " Skipping."
759                )
760
761        if self.task_customizations:
762            network_config_patches = JsonPatch(
763                [
764                    patch
765                    for patch in self.task_customizations
766                    if "networkConfiguration" in patch["path"]
767                ]
768            )
769            minimal_network_config = assemble_document_for_patches(
770                network_config_patches
771            )
772            if minimal_network_config:
773                minimal_network_config_with_patches = network_config_patches.apply(
774                    minimal_network_config
775                )
776                base_job_template["variables"]["properties"]["network_configuration"][
777                    "default"
778                ] = minimal_network_config_with_patches["networkConfiguration"]
779            try:
780                base_job_template["job_configuration"][
781                    "task_run_request"
782                ] = self.task_customizations.apply(
783                    base_job_template["job_configuration"]["task_run_request"]
784                )
785            except JsonPointerException:
786                self.logger.warning(
787                    "Unable to apply task customizations to the base job template."
788                    "You may need to update the template manually."
789                )
790
791        return base_job_template
