def preview(self) -> str: 
1025    def preview(self) -> str:
1026        """
1027        Generate a preview of the task definition and task run that will be sent to AWS.
1028        """
1029        preview = ""
1030
1031        task_definition_arn = self.task_definition_arn or "<registered at runtime>"
1032
1033        if self.task_definition or not self.task_definition_arn:
1034            task_definition = self._prepare_task_definition(
1035                self.task_definition or {},
1036                region=self.aws_credentials.region_name
1037                or "<loaded from client at runtime>",
1038            )
1039            preview += "---\n# Task definition\n"
1040            preview += yaml.dump(task_definition)
1041            preview += "\n"
1042        else:
1043            task_definition = None
1044
1045        if task_definition and task_definition.get("networkMode") == "awsvpc":
1046            vpc = "the default VPC" if not self.vpc_id else self.vpc_id
1047            network_config = {
1048                "awsvpcConfiguration": {
1049                    "subnets": f"<loaded from {vpc} at runtime>",
1050                    "assignPublicIp": "ENABLED",
1051                }
1052            }
1053        else:
1054            network_config = None
1055
1056        task_run = self._prepare_task_run(network_config, task_definition_arn)
1057        preview += "---\n# Task run request\n"
1058        preview += yaml.dump(task_run)
1059
1060        return preview

Generate a preview of the task definition and task run that will be sent to AWS.

class AwsSecret(prefect.blocks.abstract.SecretBlock): 
365class AwsSecret(SecretBlock):
366    """
367    Manages a secret in AWS's Secrets Manager.
368
369    Attributes:
370        aws_credentials: The credentials to use for authentication with AWS.
371        secret_name: The name of the secret.
372    """
373
374    _logo_url = "https://cdn.sanity.io/images/3ugk85nk/production/d74b16fe84ce626345adf235a47008fea2869a60-225x225.png"  # noqa
375    _block_type_name = "AWS Secret"
376    _documentation_url = "https://prefecthq.github.io/prefect-aws/secrets_manager/#prefect_aws.secrets_manager.AwsSecret"  # noqa
377
378    aws_credentials: AwsCredentials
379    secret_name: str = Field(default=..., description="The name of the secret.")
380
381    @sync_compatible
382    async def read_secret(
383        self,
384        version_id: str = None,
385        version_stage: str = None,
386        **read_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
387    ) -> bytes:
388        """
389        Reads the secret from the secret storage service.
390
391        Args:
392            version_id: The version of the secret to read. If not provided, the latest
393                version will be read.
394            version_stage: The version stage of the secret to read. If not provided,
395                the latest version will be read.
396            read_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to the
397                `get_secret_value` method of the boto3 client.
398
399        Returns:
400            The secret data.
401
402        Examples:
403            Reads a secret.
404            ```python
405            secrets_manager = SecretsManager.load("MY_BLOCK")
406            secrets_manager.read_secret()
407            ```
408        """
409        client = self.aws_credentials.get_secrets_manager_client()
410        if version_id is not None:
411            read_kwargs["VersionId"] = version_id
412        if version_stage is not None:
413            read_kwargs["VersionStage"] = version_stage
414        response = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
415            client.get_secret_value, SecretId=self.secret_name, **read_kwargs
416        )
417        if "SecretBinary" in response:
418            secret = response["SecretBinary"]
419        elif "SecretString" in response:
420            secret = response["SecretString"]
421        arn = response["ARN"]
422        self.logger.info(f"The secret {arn!r} data was successfully read.")
423        return secret
424
425    @sync_compatible
426    async def write_secret(
427        self, secret_data: bytes, **put_or_create_secret_kwargs: Dict[str, Any]
428    ) -> str:
429        """
430        Writes the secret to the secret storage service as a SecretBinary;
431        if it doesn't exist, it will be created.
432
433        Args:
434            secret_data: The secret data to write.
435            **put_or_create_secret_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to
436                put_secret_value or create_secret method of the boto3 client.
437
438        Returns:
439            The path that the secret was written to.
440
441        Examples:
442            Write some secret data.
443            ```python
444            secrets_manager = SecretsManager.load("MY_BLOCK")
445            secrets_manager.write_secret(b"my_secret_data")
446            ```
447        """
448        client = self.aws_credentials.get_secrets_manager_client()
449        try:
450            response = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
451                client.put_secret_value,
452                SecretId=self.secret_name,
453                SecretBinary=secret_data,
454                **put_or_create_secret_kwargs,
455            )
456        except client.exceptions.ResourceNotFoundException:
457            self.logger.info(
458                f"The secret {self.secret_name!r} does not exist yet, creating it now."
459            )
460            response = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
461                client.create_secret,
462                Name=self.secret_name,
463                SecretBinary=secret_data,
464                **put_or_create_secret_kwargs,
465            )
466        arn = response["ARN"]
467        self.logger.info(f"The secret data was written successfully to {arn!r}.")
468        return arn
469
470    @sync_compatible
471    async def delete_secret(
472        self,
473        recovery_window_in_days: int = 30,
474        force_delete_without_recovery: bool = False,
475        **delete_kwargs: Dict[str, Any],
476    ) -> str:
477        """
478        Deletes the secret from the secret storage service.
479
480        Args:
481            recovery_window_in_days: The number of days to wait before permanently
482                deleting the secret. Must be between 7 and 30 days.
483            force_delete_without_recovery: If True, the secret will be deleted
484                immediately without a recovery window.
485            **delete_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments to pass to the
486                delete_secret method of the boto3 client.
487
488        Returns:
489            The path that the secret was deleted from.
490
491        Examples:
492            Deletes the secret with a recovery window of 15 days.
493            ```python
494            secrets_manager = SecretsManager.load("MY_BLOCK")
495            secrets_manager.delete_secret(recovery_window_in_days=15)
496            ```
497        """
498        if force_delete_without_recovery and recovery_window_in_days:
499            raise ValueError(
500                "Cannot specify recovery window and force delete without recovery."
501            )
502        elif not (7 <= recovery_window_in_days <= 30):
503            raise ValueError(
504                "Recovery window must be between 7 and 30 days, got "
505                f"{recovery_window_in_days}."
506            )
507
508        client = self.aws_credentials.get_secrets_manager_client()
509        response = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
510            client.delete_secret,
511            SecretId=self.secret_name,
512            RecoveryWindowInDays=recovery_window_in_days,
513            ForceDeleteWithoutRecovery=force_delete_without_recovery,
514            **delete_kwargs,
515        )
516        arn = response["ARN"]
517        self.logger.info(f"The secret {arn} was deleted successfully.")
518        return arn

Manages a secret in AWS's Secrets Manager.

Attributes: aws_credentials: The credentials to use for authentication with AWS. secret_name: The name of the secret.

aws_credentials: AwsCredentials
secret_name: str

class ECSWorker(prefect.workers.base.BaseWorker): 
 604class ECSWorker(BaseWorker):
 605    """
 606    A Prefect worker to run flow runs as ECS tasks.
 607    """
 608
 609    type = "ecs"
 610    job_configuration = ECSJobConfiguration
 611    job_configuration_variables = ECSVariables
 612    _description = (
 613        "Execute flow runs within containers on AWS ECS. Works with EC2 "
 614        "and Fargate clusters. Requires an AWS account."
 615    )
 616    _display_name = "AWS Elastic Container Service"
 617    _documentation_url = "https://prefecthq.github.io/prefect-aws/ecs_worker/"
 618    _logo_url = "https://cdn.sanity.io/images/3ugk85nk/production/d74b16fe84ce626345adf235a47008fea2869a60-225x225.png"  # noqa
 619
 620    async def run(
 621        self,
 622        flow_run: "FlowRun",
 623        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
 624        task_status: Optional[anyio.abc.TaskStatus] = None,
 625    ) -> BaseWorkerResult:
 626        """
 627        Runs a given flow run on the current worker.
 628        """
 629        ecs_client = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 630            self._get_client, configuration, "ecs"
 631        )
 632
 633        logger = self.get_flow_run_logger(flow_run)
 634
 635        (
 636            task_arn,
 637            cluster_arn,
 638            task_definition,
 639            is_new_task_definition,
 640        ) = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 641            self._create_task_and_wait_for_start,
 642            logger,
 643            ecs_client,
 644            configuration,
 645            flow_run,
 646        )
 647
 648        # The task identifier is "{cluster}::{task}" where we use the configured cluster
 649        # if set to preserve matching by name rather than arn
 650        # Note "::" is used despite the Prefect standard being ":" because ARNs contain
 651        # single colons.
 652        identifier = (
 653            (configuration.cluster if configuration.cluster else cluster_arn)
 654            + "::"
 655            + task_arn
 656        )
 657
 658        if task_status:
 659            task_status.started(identifier)
 660
 661        status_code = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
 662            self._watch_task_and_get_exit_code,
 663            logger,
 664            configuration,
 665            task_arn,
 666            cluster_arn,
 667            task_definition,
 668            is_new_task_definition and configuration.auto_deregister_task_definition,
 669            ecs_client,
 670        )
 671
 672        return ECSWorkerResult(
 673            identifier=identifier,
 674            # If the container does not start the exit code can be null but we must
 675            # still report a status code. We use a -1 to indicate a special code.
 676            status_code=status_code if status_code is not None else -1,
 677        )
 678
 679    def _get_client(
 680        self, configuration: ECSJobConfiguration, client_type: Union[str, ClientType]
 681    ) -> _ECSClient:
 682        """
 683        Get a boto3 client of client_type. Will use a cached client if one exists.
 684        """
 685        return configuration.aws_credentials.get_client(client_type)
 686
 687    def _create_task_and_wait_for_start(
 688        self,
 689        logger: logging.Logger,
 690        ecs_client: _ECSClient,
 691        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
 692        flow_run: FlowRun,
 693    ) -> Tuple[str, str, dict, bool]:
 694        """
 695        Register the task definition, create the task run, and wait for it to start.
 696
 697        Returns a tuple of
 698        - The task ARN
 699        - The task's cluster ARN
 700        - The task definition
 701        - A bool indicating if the task definition is newly registered
 702        """
 703        task_definition_arn = configuration.task_run_request.get("taskDefinition")
 704        new_task_definition_registered = False
 705
 706        if not task_definition_arn:
 707            task_definition = self._prepare_task_definition(
 708                configuration, region=ecs_client.meta.region_name, flow_run=flow_run
 709            )
 710            (
 711                task_definition_arn,
 712                new_task_definition_registered,
 713            ) = self._get_or_register_task_definition(
 714                logger, ecs_client, configuration, flow_run, task_definition
 715            )
 716        else:
 717            task_definition = self._retrieve_task_definition(
 718                logger, ecs_client, task_definition_arn
 719            )
 720            if configuration.task_definition:
 721                logger.warning(
 722                    "Ignoring task definition in configuration since task definition"
 723                    " ARN is provided on the task run request."
 724                )
 725
 726        self._validate_task_definition(task_definition, configuration)
 727
 728        _TASK_DEFINITION_CACHE[flow_run.deployment_id] = task_definition_arn
 729
 730        logger.info(f"Using ECS task definition {task_definition_arn!r}...")
 731        logger.debug(
 732            f"Task definition {json.dumps(task_definition, indent=2, default=str)}"
 733        )
 734
 735        task_run_request = self._prepare_task_run_request(
 736            configuration,
 737            task_definition,
 738            task_definition_arn,
 739        )
 740
 741        logger.info("Creating ECS task run...")
 742        logger.debug(
 743            "Task run request"
 744            f"{json.dumps(mask_api_key(task_run_request), indent=2, default=str)}"
 745        )
 746
 747        try:
 748            task = self._create_task_run(ecs_client, task_run_request)
 749            task_arn = task["taskArn"]
 750            cluster_arn = task["clusterArn"]
 751        except Exception as exc:
 752            self._report_task_run_creation_failure(configuration, task_run_request, exc)
 753            raise
 754
 755        logger.info("Waiting for ECS task run to start...")
 756        self._wait_for_task_start(
 757            logger,
 758            configuration,
 759            task_arn,
 760            cluster_arn,
 761            ecs_client,
 762            timeout=configuration.task_start_timeout_seconds,
 763        )
 764
 765        return task_arn, cluster_arn, task_definition, new_task_definition_registered
 766
 767    def _get_or_register_task_definition(
 768        self,
 769        logger: logging.Logger,
 770        ecs_client: _ECSClient,
 771        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
 772        flow_run: FlowRun,
 773        task_definition: dict,
 774    ) -> Tuple[str, bool]:
 775        """Get or register a task definition for the given flow run.
 776
 777        Returns a tuple of the task definition ARN and a bool indicating if the task
 778        definition is newly registered.
 779        """
 780
 781        cached_task_definition_arn = _TASK_DEFINITION_CACHE.get(flow_run.deployment_id)
 782        new_task_definition_registered = False
 783
 784        if cached_task_definition_arn:
 785            try:
 786                cached_task_definition = self._retrieve_task_definition(
 787                    logger, ecs_client, cached_task_definition_arn
 788                )
 789                if not cached_task_definition[
 790                    "status"
 791                ] == "ACTIVE" or not self._task_definitions_equal(
 792                    task_definition, cached_task_definition
 793                ):
 794                    cached_task_definition_arn = None
 795            except Exception:
 796                cached_task_definition_arn = None
 797
 798        if (
 799            not cached_task_definition_arn
 800            and configuration.match_latest_revision_in_family
 801        ):
 802            family_name = task_definition.get("family", ECS_DEFAULT_FAMILY)
 803            try:
 804                task_definition_from_family = self._retrieve_task_definition(
 805                    logger, ecs_client, family_name
 806                )
 807                if task_definition_from_family and self._task_definitions_equal(
 808                    task_definition, task_definition_from_family
 809                ):
 810                    cached_task_definition_arn = task_definition_from_family[
 811                        "taskDefinitionArn"
 812                    ]
 813            except Exception:
 814                cached_task_definition_arn = None
 815
 816        if not cached_task_definition_arn:
 817            task_definition_arn = self._register_task_definition(
 818                logger, ecs_client, task_definition
 819            )
 820            new_task_definition_registered = True
 821        else:
 822            task_definition_arn = cached_task_definition_arn
 823
 824        return task_definition_arn, new_task_definition_registered
 825
 826    def _watch_task_and_get_exit_code(
 827        self,
 828        logger: logging.Logger,
 829        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
 830        task_arn: str,
 831        cluster_arn: str,
 832        task_definition: dict,
 833        deregister_task_definition: bool,
 834        ecs_client: _ECSClient,
 835    ) -> Optional[int]:
 836        """
 837        Wait for the task run to complete and retrieve the exit code of the Prefect
 838        container.
 839        """
 840
 841        # Wait for completion and stream logs
 842        task = self._wait_for_task_finish(
 843            logger,
 844            configuration,
 845            task_arn,
 846            cluster_arn,
 847            task_definition,
 848            ecs_client,
 849        )
 850
 851        if deregister_task_definition:
 852            ecs_client.deregister_task_definition(
 853                taskDefinition=task["taskDefinitionArn"]
 854            )
 855
 856        container_name = (
 857            configuration.container_name
 858            or _container_name_from_task_definition(task_definition)
 859            or ECS_DEFAULT_CONTAINER_NAME
 860        )
 861
 862        # Check the status code of the Prefect container
 863        container = _get_container(task["containers"], container_name)
 864        assert (
 865            container is not None
 866        ), f"'{container_name}' container missing from task: {task}"
 867        status_code = container.get("exitCode")
 868        self._report_container_status_code(logger, container_name, status_code)
 869
 870        return status_code
 871
 872    def _report_container_status_code(
 873        self, logger: logging.Logger, name: str, status_code: Optional[int]
 874    ) -> None:
 875        """
 876        Display a log for the given container status code.
 877        """
 878        if status_code is None:
 879            logger.error(
 880                f"Task exited without reporting an exit status for container {name!r}."
 881            )
 882        elif status_code == 0:
 883            logger.info(f"Container {name!r} exited successfully.")
 884        else:
 885            logger.warning(
 886                f"Container {name!r} exited with non-zero exit code {status_code}."
 887            )
 888
 889    def _report_task_run_creation_failure(
 890        self, configuration: ECSJobConfiguration, task_run: dict, exc: Exception
 891    ) -> None:
 892        """
 893        Wrap common AWS task run creation failures with nicer user-facing messages.
 894        """
 895        # AWS generates exception types at runtime so they must be captured a bit
 896        # differently than normal.
 897        if "ClusterNotFoundException" in str(exc):
 898            cluster = task_run.get("cluster", "default")
 899            raise RuntimeError(
 900                f"Failed to run ECS task, cluster {cluster!r} not found. "
 901                "Confirm that the cluster is configured in your region."
 902            ) from exc
 903        elif (
 904            "No Container Instances" in str(exc) and task_run.get("launchType") == "EC2"
 905        ):
 906            cluster = task_run.get("cluster", "default")
 907            raise RuntimeError(
 908                f"Failed to run ECS task, cluster {cluster!r} does not appear to "
 909                "have any container instances associated with it. Confirm that you "
 910                "have EC2 container instances available."
 911            ) from exc
 912        elif (
 913            "failed to validate logger args" in str(exc)
 914            and "AccessDeniedException" in str(exc)
 915            and configuration.configure_cloudwatch_logs
 916        ):
 917            raise RuntimeError(
 918                "Failed to run ECS task, the attached execution role does not appear"
 919                " to have sufficient permissions. Ensure that the execution role"
 920                f" {configuration.execution_role!r} has permissions"
 921                " logs:CreateLogStream, logs:CreateLogGroup, and logs:PutLogEvents."
 922            )
 923        else:
 924            raise
 925
 926    def _validate_task_definition(
 927        self, task_definition: dict, configuration: ECSJobConfiguration
 928    ) -> None:
 929        """
 930        Ensure that the task definition is compatible with the configuration.
 931
 932        Raises `ValueError` on incompatibility. Returns `None` on success.
 933        """
 934        launch_type = configuration.task_run_request.get(
 935            "launchType", ECS_DEFAULT_LAUNCH_TYPE
 936        )
 937        if (
 938            launch_type != "EC2"
 939            and "FARGATE" not in task_definition["requiresCompatibilities"]
 940        ):
 941            raise ValueError(
 942                "Task definition does not have 'FARGATE' in 'requiresCompatibilities'"
 943                f" and cannot be used with launch type {launch_type!r}"
 944            )
 945
 946        if launch_type == "FARGATE" or launch_type == "FARGATE_SPOT":
 947            # Only the 'awsvpc' network mode is supported when using FARGATE
 948            network_mode = task_definition.get("networkMode")
 949            if network_mode != "awsvpc":
 950                raise ValueError(
 951                    f"Found network mode {network_mode!r} which is not compatible with "
 952                    f"launch type {launch_type!r}. Use either the 'EC2' launch "
 953                    "type or the 'awsvpc' network mode."
 954                )
 955
 956        if configuration.configure_cloudwatch_logs and not task_definition.get(
 957            "executionRoleArn"
 958        ):
 959            raise ValueError(
 960                "An execution role arn must be set on the task definition to use "
 961                "`configure_cloudwatch_logs` or `stream_logs` but no execution role "
 962                "was found on the task definition."
 963            )
 964
 965    def _register_task_definition(
 966        self,
 967        logger: logging.Logger,
 968        ecs_client: _ECSClient,
 969        task_definition: dict,
 970    ) -> str:
 971        """
 972        Register a new task definition with AWS.
 973
 974        Returns the ARN.
 975        """
 976        logger.info("Registering ECS task definition...")
 977        logger.debug(
 978            "Task definition request"
 979            f"{json.dumps(task_definition, indent=2, default=str)}"
 980        )
 981        response = ecs_client.register_task_definition(**task_definition)
 982        return response["taskDefinition"]["taskDefinitionArn"]
 983
 984    def _retrieve_task_definition(
 985        self,
 986        logger: logging.Logger,
 987        ecs_client: _ECSClient,
 988        task_definition: str,
 989    ):
 990        """
 991        Retrieve an existing task definition from AWS.
 992        """
 993        if task_definition.startswith("arn:aws:ecs:"):
 994            logger.info(f"Retrieving ECS task definition {task_definition!r}...")
 995        else:
 996            logger.info(
 997                "Retrieving most recent active revision from "
 998                f"ECS task family {task_definition!r}..."
 999            )
1000        response = ecs_client.describe_task_definition(taskDefinition=task_definition)
1001        return response["taskDefinition"]
1002
1003    def _wait_for_task_start(
1004        self,
1005        logger: logging.Logger,
1006        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
1007        task_arn: str,
1008        cluster_arn: str,
1009        ecs_client: _ECSClient,
1010        timeout: int,
1011    ) -> dict:
1012        """
1013        Waits for an ECS task run to reach a RUNNING status.
1014
1015        If a STOPPED status is reached instead, an exception is raised indicating the
1016        reason that the task run did not start.
1017        """
1018        for task in self._watch_task_run(
1019            logger,
1020            configuration,
1021            task_arn,
1022            cluster_arn,
1023            ecs_client,
1024            until_status="RUNNING",
1025            timeout=timeout,
1026        ):
1027            # TODO: It is possible that the task has passed _through_ a RUNNING
1028            #       status during the polling interval. In this case, there is not an
1029            #       exception to raise.
1030            if task["lastStatus"] == "STOPPED":
1031                code = task.get("stopCode")
1032                reason = task.get("stoppedReason")
1033                # Generate a dynamic exception type from the AWS name
1034                raise type(code, (RuntimeError,), {})(reason)
1035
1036        return task
1037
1038    def _wait_for_task_finish(
1039        self,
1040        logger: logging.Logger,
1041        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
1042        task_arn: str,
1043        cluster_arn: str,
1044        task_definition: dict,
1045        ecs_client: _ECSClient,
1046    ):
1047        """
1048        Watch an ECS task until it reaches a STOPPED status.
1049
1050        If configured, logs from the Prefect container are streamed to stderr.
1051
1052        Returns a description of the task on completion.
1053        """
1054        can_stream_output = False
1055        container_name = (
1056            configuration.container_name
1057            or _container_name_from_task_definition(task_definition)
1058            or ECS_DEFAULT_CONTAINER_NAME
1059        )
1060
1061        if configuration.stream_output:
1062            container_def = _get_container(
1063                task_definition["containerDefinitions"], container_name
1064            )
1065            if not container_def:
1066                logger.warning(
1067                    "Prefect container definition not found in "
1068                    "task definition. Output cannot be streamed."
1069                )
1070            elif not container_def.get("logConfiguration"):
1071                logger.warning(
1072                    "Logging configuration not found on task. "
1073                    "Output cannot be streamed."
1074                )
1075            elif not container_def["logConfiguration"].get("logDriver") == "awslogs":
1076                logger.warning(
1077                    "Logging configuration uses unsupported "
1078                    " driver {container_def['logConfiguration'].get('logDriver')!r}. "
1079                    "Output cannot be streamed."
1080                )
1081            else:
1082                # Prepare to stream the output
1083                log_config = container_def["logConfiguration"]["options"]
1084                logs_client = self._get_client(configuration, "logs")
1085                can_stream_output = True
1086                # Track the last log timestamp to prevent double display
1087                last_log_timestamp: Optional[int] = None
1088                # Determine the name of the stream as "prefix/container/run-id"
1089                stream_name = "/".join(
1090                    [
1091                        log_config["awslogs-stream-prefix"],
1092                        container_name,
1093                        task_arn.rsplit("/")[-1],
1094                    ]
1095                )
1096                self._logger.info(
1097                    f"Streaming output from container {container_name!r}..."
1098                )
1099
1100        for task in self._watch_task_run(
1101            logger,
1102            configuration,
1103            task_arn,
1104            cluster_arn,
1105            ecs_client,
1106            current_status="RUNNING",
1107        ):
1108            if configuration.stream_output and can_stream_output:
1109                # On each poll for task run status, also retrieve available logs
1110                last_log_timestamp = self._stream_available_logs(
1111                    logger,
1112                    logs_client,
1113                    log_group=log_config["awslogs-group"],
1114                    log_stream=stream_name,
1115                    last_log_timestamp=last_log_timestamp,
1116                )
1117
1118        return task
1119
1120    def _stream_available_logs(
1121        self,
1122        logger: logging.Logger,
1123        logs_client: Any,
1124        log_group: str,
1125        log_stream: str,
1126        last_log_timestamp: Optional[int] = None,
1127    ) -> Optional[int]:
1128        """
1129        Stream logs from the given log group and stream since the last log timestamp.
1130
1131        Will continue on paginated responses until all logs are returned.
1132
1133        Returns the last log timestamp which can be used to call this method in the
1134        future.
1135        """
1136        last_log_stream_token = "NO-TOKEN"
1137        next_log_stream_token = None
1138
1139        # AWS will return the same token that we send once the end of the paginated
1140        # response is reached
1141        while last_log_stream_token != next_log_stream_token:
1142            last_log_stream_token = next_log_stream_token
1143
1144            request = {
1145                "logGroupName": log_group,
1146                "logStreamName": log_stream,
1147            }
1148
1149            if last_log_stream_token is not None:
1150                request["nextToken"] = last_log_stream_token
1151
1152            if last_log_timestamp is not None:
1153                # Bump the timestamp by one ms to avoid retrieving the last log again
1154                request["startTime"] = last_log_timestamp + 1
1155
1156            try:
1157                response = logs_client.get_log_events(**request)
1158            except Exception:
1159                logger.error(
1160                    f"Failed to read log events with request {request}",
1161                    exc_info=True,
1162                )
1163                return last_log_timestamp
1164
1165            log_events = response["events"]
1166            for log_event in log_events:
1167                # TODO: This doesn't forward to the local logger, which can be
1168                #       bad for customizing handling and understanding where the
1169                #       log is coming from, but it avoid nesting logger information
1170                #       when the content is output from a Prefect logger on the
1171                #       running infrastructure
1172                print(log_event["message"], file=sys.stderr)
1173
1174                if (
1175                    last_log_timestamp is None
1176                    or log_event["timestamp"] > last_log_timestamp
1177                ):
1178                    last_log_timestamp = log_event["timestamp"]
1179
1180            next_log_stream_token = response.get("nextForwardToken")
1181            if not log_events:
1182                # Stop reading pages if there was no data
1183                break
1184
1185        return last_log_timestamp
1186
1187    def _watch_task_run(
1188        self,
1189        logger: logging.Logger,
1190        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
1191        task_arn: str,
1192        cluster_arn: str,
1193        ecs_client: _ECSClient,
1194        current_status: str = "UNKNOWN",
1195        until_status: str = None,
1196        timeout: int = None,
1197    ) -> Generator[None, None, dict]:
1198        """
1199        Watches an ECS task run by querying every `poll_interval` seconds. After each
1200        query, the retrieved task is yielded. This function returns when the task run
1201        reaches a STOPPED status or the provided `until_status`.
1202
1203        Emits a log each time the status changes.
1204        """
1205        last_status = status = current_status
1206        t0 = time.time()
1207        while status != until_status:
1208            tasks = ecs_client.describe_tasks(
1209                tasks=[task_arn], cluster=cluster_arn, include=["TAGS"]
1210            )["tasks"]
1211
1212            if tasks:
1213                task = tasks[0]
1214
1215                status = task["lastStatus"]
1216                if status != last_status:
1217                    logger.info(f"ECS task status is {status}.")
1218
1219                yield task
1220
1221                # No point in continuing if the status is final
1222                if status == "STOPPED":
1223                    break
1224
1225                last_status = status
1226
1227            else:
1228                # Intermittently, the task will not be described. We wat to respect the
1229                # watch timeout though.
1230                logger.debug("Task not found.")
1231
1232            elapsed_time = time.time() - t0
1233            if timeout is not None and elapsed_time > timeout:
1234                raise RuntimeError(
1235                    f"Timed out after {elapsed_time}s while watching task for status "
1236                    f"{until_status or 'STOPPED'}."
1237                )
1238            time.sleep(configuration.task_watch_poll_interval)
1239
1240    def _get_or_generate_family(self, task_definition: dict, flow_run: FlowRun) -> str:
1241        """
1242        Gets or generate a family for the task definition.
1243        """
1244        family = task_definition.get("family")
1245        if not family:
1246            assert self._work_pool_name and flow_run.deployment_id
1247            family = (
1248                f"{ECS_DEFAULT_FAMILY}_{self._work_pool_name}_{flow_run.deployment_id}"
1249            )
1250        slugify(
1251            family,
1252            max_length=255,
1253            regex_pattern=r"[^a-zA-Z0-9-_]+",
1254        )
1255        return family
1256
1257    def _prepare_task_definition(
1258        self,
1259        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
1260        region: str,
1261        flow_run: FlowRun,
1262    ) -> dict:
1263        """
1264        Prepare a task definition by inferring any defaults and merging overrides.
1265        """
1266        task_definition = copy.deepcopy(configuration.task_definition)
1267
1268        # Configure the Prefect runtime container
1269        task_definition.setdefault("containerDefinitions", [])
1270
1271        # Remove empty container definitions
1272        task_definition["containerDefinitions"] = [
1273            d for d in task_definition["containerDefinitions"] if d
1274        ]
1275
1276        container_name = configuration.container_name
1277        if not container_name:
1278            container_name = (
1279                _container_name_from_task_definition(task_definition)
1280                or ECS_DEFAULT_CONTAINER_NAME
1281            )
1282
1283        container = _get_container(
1284            task_definition["containerDefinitions"], container_name
1285        )
1286        if container is None:
1287            if container_name != ECS_DEFAULT_CONTAINER_NAME:
1288                raise ValueError(
1289                    f"Container {container_name!r} not found in task definition."
1290                )
1291
1292            # Look for a container without a name
1293            for container in task_definition["containerDefinitions"]:
1294                if "name" not in container:
1295                    container["name"] = container_name
1296                    break
1297            else:
1298                container = {"name": container_name}
1299                task_definition["containerDefinitions"].append(container)
1300
1301        # Image is required so make sure it's present
1302        container.setdefault("image", get_prefect_image_name())
1303
1304        # Remove any keys that have been explicitly "unset"
1305        unset_keys = {key for key, value in configuration.env.items() if value is None}
1306        for item in tuple(container.get("environment", [])):
1307            if item["name"] in unset_keys or item["value"] is None:
1308                container["environment"].remove(item)
1309
1310        if configuration.configure_cloudwatch_logs:
1311            prefix = f"prefect-logs_{self._work_pool_name}_{flow_run.deployment_id}"
1312            container["logConfiguration"] = {
1313                "logDriver": "awslogs",
1314                "options": {
1315                    "awslogs-create-group": "true",
1316                    "awslogs-group": "prefect",
1317                    "awslogs-region": region,
1318                    "awslogs-stream-prefix": (
1319                        configuration.cloudwatch_logs_prefix or prefix
1320                    ),
1321                    **configuration.cloudwatch_logs_options,
1322                },
1323            }
1324
1325        task_definition["family"] = self._get_or_generate_family(
1326            task_definition, flow_run
1327        )
1328        # CPU and memory are required in some cases, retrieve the value to use
1329        cpu = task_definition.get("cpu") or ECS_DEFAULT_CPU
1330        memory = task_definition.get("memory") or ECS_DEFAULT_MEMORY
1331
1332        launch_type = configuration.task_run_request.get(
1333            "launchType", ECS_DEFAULT_LAUNCH_TYPE
1334        )
1335
1336        if launch_type == "FARGATE" or launch_type == "FARGATE_SPOT":
1337            # Task level memory and cpu are required when using fargate
1338            task_definition["cpu"] = str(cpu)
1339            task_definition["memory"] = str(memory)
1340
1341            # The FARGATE compatibility is required if it will be used as as launch type
1342            requires_compatibilities = task_definition.setdefault(
1343                "requiresCompatibilities", []
1344            )
1345            if "FARGATE" not in requires_compatibilities:
1346                task_definition["requiresCompatibilities"].append("FARGATE")
1347
1348            # Only the 'awsvpc' network mode is supported when using FARGATE
1349            # However, we will not enforce that here if the user has set it
1350            task_definition.setdefault("networkMode", "awsvpc")
1351
1352        elif launch_type == "EC2":
1353            # Container level memory and cpu are required when using ec2
1354            container.setdefault("cpu", cpu)
1355            container.setdefault("memory", memory)
1356
1357            # Ensure set values are cast to integers
1358            container["cpu"] = int(container["cpu"])
1359            container["memory"] = int(container["memory"])
1360
1361        # Ensure set values are cast to strings
1362        if task_definition.get("cpu"):
1363            task_definition["cpu"] = str(task_definition["cpu"])
1364        if task_definition.get("memory"):
1365            task_definition["memory"] = str(task_definition["memory"])
1366
1367        return task_definition
1368
1369    def _load_network_configuration(
1370        self, vpc_id: Optional[str], configuration: ECSJobConfiguration
1371    ) -> dict:
1372        """
1373        Load settings from a specific VPC or the default VPC and generate a task
1374        run request's network configuration.
1375        """
1376        ec2_client = self._get_client(configuration, "ec2")
1377        vpc_message = "the default VPC" if not vpc_id else f"VPC with ID {vpc_id}"
1378
1379        if not vpc_id:
1380            # Retrieve the default VPC
1381            describe = {"Filters": [{"Name": "isDefault", "Values": ["true"]}]}
1382        else:
1383            describe = {"VpcIds": [vpc_id]}
1384
1385        vpcs = ec2_client.describe_vpcs(**describe)["Vpcs"]
1386        if not vpcs:
1387            help_message = (
1388                "Pass an explicit `vpc_id` or configure a default VPC."
1389                if not vpc_id
1390                else "Check that the VPC exists in the current region."
1391            )
1392            raise ValueError(
1393                f"Failed to find {vpc_message}. "
1394                "Network configuration cannot be inferred. " + help_message
1395            )
1396
1397        vpc_id = vpcs[0]["VpcId"]
1398        subnets = ec2_client.describe_subnets(
1399            Filters=[{"Name": "vpc-id", "Values": [vpc_id]}]
1400        )["Subnets"]
1401        if not subnets:
1402            raise ValueError(
1403                f"Failed to find subnets for {vpc_message}. "
1404                "Network configuration cannot be inferred."
1405            )
1406
1407        return {
1408            "awsvpcConfiguration": {
1409                "subnets": [s["SubnetId"] for s in subnets],
1410                "assignPublicIp": "ENABLED",
1411                "securityGroups": [],
1412            }
1413        }
1414
1415    def _custom_network_configuration(
1416        self,
1417        vpc_id: str,
1418        network_configuration: dict,
1419        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
1420    ) -> dict:
1421        """
1422        Load settings from a specific VPC or the default VPC and generate a task
1423        run request's network configuration.
1424        """
1425        ec2_client = self._get_client(configuration, "ec2")
1426        vpc_message = f"VPC with ID {vpc_id}"
1427
1428        vpcs = ec2_client.describe_vpcs(VpcIds=[vpc_id]).get("Vpcs")
1429
1430        if not vpcs:
1431            raise ValueError(
1432                f"Failed to find {vpc_message}. "
1433                + "Network configuration cannot be inferred. "
1434                + "Pass an explicit `vpc_id`."
1435            )
1436
1437        vpc_id = vpcs[0]["VpcId"]
1438        subnets = ec2_client.describe_subnets(
1439            Filters=[{"Name": "vpc-id", "Values": [vpc_id]}]
1440        )["Subnets"]
1441
1442        if not subnets:
1443            raise ValueError(
1444                f"Failed to find subnets for {vpc_message}. "
1445                + "Network configuration cannot be inferred."
1446            )
1447
1448        subnet_ids = [subnet["SubnetId"] for subnet in subnets]
1449
1450        config_subnets = network_configuration.get("subnets", [])
1451        if not all(conf_sn in subnet_ids for conf_sn in config_subnets):
1452            raise ValueError(
1453                f"Subnets {config_subnets} not found within {vpc_message}."
1454                + "Please check that VPC is associated with supplied subnets."
1455            )
1456
1457        return {"awsvpcConfiguration": network_configuration}
1458
1459    def _prepare_task_run_request(
1460        self,
1461        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
1462        task_definition: dict,
1463        task_definition_arn: str,
1464    ) -> dict:
1465        """
1466        Prepare a task run request payload.
1467        """
1468        task_run_request = deepcopy(configuration.task_run_request)
1469
1470        task_run_request.setdefault("taskDefinition", task_definition_arn)
1471        assert task_run_request["taskDefinition"] == task_definition_arn
1472        capacityProviderStrategy = task_run_request.get("capacityProviderStrategy")
1473
1474        if capacityProviderStrategy:
1475            # Should not be provided at all if capacityProviderStrategy is set, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/APIReference/API_RunTask.html#ECS-RunTask-request-capacityProviderStrategy  # noqa
1476            self._logger.warning(
1477                "Found capacityProviderStrategy. "
1478                "Removing launchType from task run request."
1479            )
1480            task_run_request.pop("launchType", None)
1481
1482        elif task_run_request.get("launchType") == "FARGATE_SPOT":
1483            # Should not be provided at all for FARGATE SPOT
1484            task_run_request.pop("launchType", None)
1485
1486            # A capacity provider strategy is required for FARGATE SPOT
1487            task_run_request["capacityProviderStrategy"] = [
1488                {"capacityProvider": "FARGATE_SPOT", "weight": 1}
1489            ]
1490        overrides = task_run_request.get("overrides", {})
1491        container_overrides = overrides.get("containerOverrides", [])
1492
1493        # Ensure the network configuration is present if using awsvpc for network mode
1494        if (
1495            task_definition.get("networkMode") == "awsvpc"
1496            and not task_run_request.get("networkConfiguration")
1497            and not configuration.network_configuration
1498        ):
1499            task_run_request["networkConfiguration"] = self._load_network_configuration(
1500                configuration.vpc_id, configuration
1501            )
1502
1503        # Use networkConfiguration if supplied by user
1504        if (
1505            task_definition.get("networkMode") == "awsvpc"
1506            and configuration.network_configuration
1507            and configuration.vpc_id
1508        ):
1509            task_run_request[
1510                "networkConfiguration"
1511            ] = self._custom_network_configuration(
1512                configuration.vpc_id,
1513                configuration.network_configuration,
1514                configuration,
1515            )
1516
1517        # Ensure the container name is set if not provided at template time
1518
1519        container_name = (
1520            configuration.container_name
1521            or _container_name_from_task_definition(task_definition)
1522            or ECS_DEFAULT_CONTAINER_NAME
1523        )
1524
1525        if container_overrides and not container_overrides[0].get("name"):
1526            container_overrides[0]["name"] = container_name
1527
1528        # Ensure configuration command is respected post-templating
1529
1530        orchestration_container = _get_container(container_overrides, container_name)
1531
1532        if orchestration_container:
1533            # Override the command if given on the configuration
1534            if configuration.command:
1535                orchestration_container["command"] = configuration.command
1536
1537        # Clean up templated variable formatting
1538
1539        for container in container_overrides:
1540            if isinstance(container.get("command"), str):
1541                container["command"] = shlex.split(container["command"])
1542            if isinstance(container.get("environment"), dict):
1543                container["environment"] = [
1544                    {"name": k, "value": v} for k, v in container["environment"].items()
1545                ]
1546
1547            # Remove null values — they're not allowed by AWS
1548            container["environment"] = [
1549                item
1550                for item in container.get("environment", [])
1551                if item["value"] is not None
1552            ]
1553
1554        if isinstance(task_run_request.get("tags"), dict):
1555            task_run_request["tags"] = [
1556                {"key": k, "value": v} for k, v in task_run_request["tags"].items()
1557            ]
1558
1559        if overrides.get("cpu"):
1560            overrides["cpu"] = str(overrides["cpu"])
1561
1562        if overrides.get("memory"):
1563            overrides["memory"] = str(overrides["memory"])
1564
1565        # Ensure configuration tags and env are respected post-templating
1566
1567        tags = [
1568            item
1569            for item in task_run_request.get("tags", [])
1570            if item["key"] not in configuration.labels.keys()
1571        ] + [
1572            {"key": k, "value": v}
1573            for k, v in configuration.labels.items()
1574            if v is not None
1575        ]
1576
1577        # Slugify tags keys and values
1578        tags = [
1579            {
1580                "key": slugify(
1581                    item["key"],
1582                    regex_pattern=_TAG_REGEX,
1583                    allow_unicode=True,
1584                    lowercase=False,
1585                ),
1586                "value": slugify(
1587                    item["value"],
1588                    regex_pattern=_TAG_REGEX,
1589                    allow_unicode=True,
1590                    lowercase=False,
1591                ),
1592            }
1593            for item in tags
1594        ]
1595
1596        if tags:
1597            task_run_request["tags"] = tags
1598
1599        if orchestration_container:
1600            environment = [
1601                item
1602                for item in orchestration_container.get("environment", [])
1603                if item["name"] not in configuration.env.keys()
1604            ] + [
1605                {"name": k, "value": v}
1606                for k, v in configuration.env.items()
1607                if v is not None
1608            ]
1609            if environment:
1610                orchestration_container["environment"] = environment
1611
1612        # Remove empty container overrides
1613
1614        overrides["containerOverrides"] = [v for v in container_overrides if v]
1615
1616        return task_run_request
1617
1618    @retry(
1619        stop=stop_after_attempt(MAX_CREATE_TASK_RUN_ATTEMPTS),
1620        wait=wait_fixed(CREATE_TASK_RUN_MIN_DELAY_SECONDS)
1621        + wait_random(
1622            CREATE_TASK_RUN_MIN_DELAY_JITTER_SECONDS,
1623            CREATE_TASK_RUN_MAX_DELAY_JITTER_SECONDS,
1624        ),
1625        reraise=True,
1626    )
1627    def _create_task_run(self, ecs_client: _ECSClient, task_run_request: dict) -> str:
1628        """
1629        Create a run of a task definition.
1630
1631        Returns the task run ARN.
1632        """
1633        task = ecs_client.run_task(**task_run_request)
1634        if task["failures"]:
1635            raise RuntimeError(
1636                f"Failed to run ECS task: {task['failures'][0]['reason']}"
1637            )
1638        elif not task["tasks"]:
1639            raise RuntimeError(
1640                "Failed to run ECS task: no tasks or failures were returned."
1641            )
1642        return task["tasks"][0]
1643
1644    def _task_definitions_equal(self, taskdef_1, taskdef_2) -> bool:
1645        """
1646        Compare two task definitions.
1647
1648        Since one may come from the AWS API and have populated defaults, we do our best
1649        to homogenize the definitions without changing their meaning.
1650        """
1651        if taskdef_1 == taskdef_2:
1652            return True
1653
1654        if taskdef_1 is None or taskdef_2 is None:
1655            return False
1656
1657        taskdef_1 = copy.deepcopy(taskdef_1)
1658        taskdef_2 = copy.deepcopy(taskdef_2)
1659
1660        for taskdef in (taskdef_1, taskdef_2):
1661            # Set defaults that AWS would set after registration
1662            container_definitions = taskdef.get("containerDefinitions", [])
1663            essential = any(
1664                container.get("essential") for container in container_definitions
1665            )
1666            if not essential:
1667                container_definitions[0].setdefault("essential", True)
1668
1669            taskdef.setdefault("networkMode", "bridge")
1670
1671        _drop_empty_keys_from_task_definition(taskdef_1)
1672        _drop_empty_keys_from_task_definition(taskdef_2)
1673
1674        # Clear fields that change on registration for comparison
1675        for field in ECS_POST_REGISTRATION_FIELDS:
1676            taskdef_1.pop(field, None)
1677            taskdef_2.pop(field, None)
1678
1679        return taskdef_1 == taskdef_2
1680
1681    async def kill_infrastructure(
1682        self,
1683        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
1684        infrastructure_pid: str,
1685        grace_seconds: int = 30,
1686    ) -> None:
1687        """
1688        Kill a task running on ECS.
1689
1690        Args:
1691            infrastructure_pid: A cluster and task arn combination. This should match a
1692                value yielded by `ECSWorker.run`.
1693        """
1694        if grace_seconds != 30:
1695            self._logger.warning(
1696                f"Kill grace period of {grace_seconds}s requested, but AWS does not "
1697                "support dynamic grace period configuration so 30s will be used. "
1698                "See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/ecs-agent-config.html for configuration of grace periods."  # noqa
1699            )
1700        cluster, task = parse_identifier(infrastructure_pid)
1701        await run_sync_in_worker_thread(self._stop_task, configuration, cluster, task)
1702
1703    def _stop_task(
1704        self, configuration: ECSJobConfiguration, cluster: str, task: str
1705    ) -> None:
1706        """
1707        Stop a running ECS task.
1708        """
1709        if configuration.cluster is not None and cluster != configuration.cluster:
1710            raise InfrastructureNotAvailable(
1711                "Cannot stop ECS task: this infrastructure block has access to "
1712                f"cluster {configuration.cluster!r} but the task is running in cluster "
1713                f"{cluster!r}."
1714            )
1715
1716        ecs_client = self._get_client(configuration, "ecs")
1717        try:
1718            ecs_client.stop_task(cluster=cluster, task=task)
1719        except Exception as exc:
1720            # Raise a special exception if the task does not exist
1721            if "ClusterNotFound" in str(exc):
1722                raise InfrastructureNotFound(
1723                    f"Cannot stop ECS task: the cluster {cluster!r} could not be found."
1724                ) from exc
1725            if "not find task" in str(exc) or "referenced task was not found" in str(
1726                exc
1727            ):
1728                raise InfrastructureNotFound(
1729                    f"Cannot stop ECS task: the task {task!r} could not be found in "
1730                    f"cluster {cluster!r}."
1731                ) from exc
1732            if "no registered tasks" in str(exc):
1733                raise InfrastructureNotFound(
1734                    f"Cannot stop ECS task: the cluster {cluster!r} has no tasks."
1735                ) from exc
1736
1737            # Reraise unknown exceptions
1738            raise

A Prefect worker to run flow runs as ECS tasks.

type = 'ecs'

async def run( self, flow_run: prefect.server.schemas.core.FlowRun, configuration: prefect_aws.workers.ecs_worker.ECSJobConfiguration, task_status: Optional[anyio.abc.TaskStatus] = None) -> prefect.workers.base.BaseWorkerResult: 
620    async def run(
621        self,
622        flow_run: "FlowRun",
623        configuration: ECSJobConfiguration,
624        task_status: Optional[anyio.abc.TaskStatus] = None,
625    ) -> BaseWorkerResult:
626        """
627        Runs a given flow run on the current worker.
628        """
629        ecs_client = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
630            self._get_client, configuration, "ecs"
631        )
632
633        logger = self.get_flow_run_logger(flow_run)
634
635        (
636            task_arn,
637            cluster_arn,
638            task_definition,
639            is_new_task_definition,
640        ) = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
641            self._create_task_and_wait_for_start,
642            logger,
643            ecs_client,
644            configuration,
645            flow_run,
646        )
647
648        # The task identifier is "{cluster}::{task}" where we use the configured cluster
649        # if set to preserve matching by name rather than arn
650        # Note "::" is used despite the Prefect standard being ":" because ARNs contain
651        # single colons.
652        identifier = (
653            (configuration.cluster if configuration.cluster else cluster_arn)
654            + "::"
655            + task_arn
656        )
657
658        if task_status:
659            task_status.started(identifier)
660
661        status_code = await run_sync_in_worker_thread(
662            self._watch_task_and_get_exit_code,
663            logger,
664            configuration,
665            task_arn,
666            cluster_arn,
667            task_definition,
668            is_new_task_definition and configuration.auto_deregister_task_definition,
669            ecs_client,
670        )
671
672        return ECSWorkerResult(
673            identifier=identifier,
674            # If the container does not start the exit code can be null but we must
675            # still report a status code. We use a -1 to indicate a special code.
676            status_code=status_code if status_code is not None else -1,
677        )
